title: Culture Night in Bantry
description:
Follow a vibrant culture trail across Bantry, weaving in music, crafts and dance on Culture Night 2024.
The evening’s highlight will be a concert in St. Brendan’s Church in the West Cork Harbour town, where writers and musicians will respond creatively to the theme of rhythm.

CONCERT
Words, Music, Rhythm: A West Cork Music Culture Night Concert
Coordinator: West Cork Music | Time: 8pm-9:45pm
BOOK ONLINE: https://www.westcorkmusic.ie/culture-night/
Join us for a concert in St Brendan’s Church where we will showcase the artistic traditions Bantry celebrates across the three festivals West Cork Music hosts over six weeks each summer – the West Cork Chamber Music Festival, the West Cork Literary Festival, and Masters of Tradition.

Featuring:
• Café Cork Flute Ensemble. Based at Cork School of Music, this ensemble is made up of enthusiastic amateur and professional flautists who perform a wide variety of classical, modern, and popular music on all types of flute from the piccolo to the contrabass.
• Leeanne O’Donnell. Leeanne started her storytelling career working in radio with RTÉ and BBC, and she has made a number of award-winning radio documentaries. She wrote her first novel, Sparks of Bright Matter, from her home on the foothills of a mountain in West Cork.
• Oisín Morrison and friends. A talented harper, flute player and composer from Dublin, Oisín has been recognised with various awards, including the prestigious Bonn Óir Sheáin Uí Riada. He will be joined by friends at the Culture Night concert to explore rhythm through the medium of Irish traditional music.

This year’s Culture Night trail in Bantry includes activities in multiple languages (English, Irish, and Ukrainian) and crafts (knitting and crochet), as well as music. The town-wide trail celebrates West Cork’s cultural richness and community, as well as the underlying rhythms of its words, music, and creativity.

EVENTS COORDINATED BY WEST CORK MUSIC
Young Performers’ Showcase
Coordinator: Curious Keys Music School
Time: 5:15pm-5:45pm
Students from Curious Keys will showcase their talents on Culture Night in Bantry.
Wheelchair accessible: No
Location: Curious Keys Music School, 10 New Street, P75 NF84 [Over Forest & Flock]

Knit & Stitch Social Evening
Coordinators: Bantry Yarns & West Café & Wine Bar
Time: 8pm-10:30pm
Stitch in sync with fellow knitters and crocheters as part of Bantry’s Culture Night.
So, get those needles clicking in sync with other knitters and crocheters at at a social evening of learning and crafting on Culture Night, led by Bantry Yarns’ Jaq Stedman in the convivial setting of Bantry’s West Café and Wine Bar.
Booking Essential: https://bantryyarns.ie/knit-and-stitch-social-evening
Wheelchair accessible: Yes
Location: West Café & Wine Bar, Bridewell Lane, Bantry, P75 KR12

description:
Carracastle Futures presents a screening of 'Skylark,' an award winning film that was made in the locality, followed by a Q&A with the Director and finishing up with music from local musicians.

The event will run from 8pm until 9:30pm, with no breaks.

title: Culture Night in DCU St. Patricks Campus
description:
For Culture Night 2024, DCU will present a series of specially programmed events at St. Patrick's Campus in Drumcondra. Expect a fun-packed, thrill-filled family programme with performances, art workshops and exhibitions, traditional garden games and music.

Senco Sensory Bus will be on site offering a sensory haven equipped with the latest sensory products.

And, as always the public is invited to join the selection of tours on offer throughout the evening.

title: Culture Night Late – Secret Gig
description:
Cork City Council Night Time Economy & The Good Room team up to programme and present a one off late night concert in a secret location in the city. Join two of Cork’s most interesting acts for this creative show.

Fixity is a project formed by Cork based multi-instrumentalist and composer Dan Walsh. The project is based around the impossibility of repeated moments and manifests in solo and ensemble settings with collaborators from throughout Ireland and beyond. For this one off special Fixity becomes a 5 piece with Dan on drums and vocals, Sean Maynard Smith on Bass, Brendan Riordan on Guitar, Steve Welsh on Sax/Flutes and Sam Clague on Bass clarinet/flute.

Ana Palindrome are a Cork based band made up of musicians Niamh Dalton (vocals, fiddle), Ruairi de Búrca (synths, programming) and Sara Leslie (bass, vocals) The project centres around a fictionalised character, Ana Palindrome, developing a personality and aesthetic that propels the vision for their songwriting & music making. Ana is your nightmare-dream girl. Perfect for the night that's in it. They recently played at “In The Meadows” with Lankum and Mogwai in Kilmainham, Dublin.

Booking is essential.
host: Cork City Council Night Time and the Good Room
fullAddress: North Main Street Shopping Centre, North Main Street, Centre, Cork, Ireland

description: “Culture Night lights” is back, an exhibition of illuminated lantern sculptures made by students of Ard Scoil na nDéise. This year the work will be on show in a brand new location at the Civic Offices in Dungarvan just as light starts to fall, all are welcome to come along and view these magnificent pieces that have been made by our students. in association with Waterford City & County Arts Office.

description:
Supporting local enterprise and design for the last 15 years, We Love Markets are thrilled to host their second Culture Night Market at the fantastic historical grounds of The Digital Hub.

Enjoy delicious food from hot food trucks, artisan treats made locally by passionate producers and hot drinks from The Coffee Container, plus vendors selling local Irish design, mid-century furniture, vintage clothing, and art and crafts. Live DJs will also be bringing good vibes to The Digital Hub, soundtracking this year’s bustling market. After a huge success last year, the Culture Night Market 2024 from We Love Markets promises to be an event not to be missed.

title: Culture Night Night Moves
description:
CULTURE NIGHT, NIGHT MOVES, is a late night programme produced by Droichead Arts Centre in partnership with the Drogheda Night Time Economy Advisor, and supported by the Arts Council, Louth Arts Office and Love Drogheda BIDS celebrating Culture Night 2024. Collaborating with curators; musician/ composer, SJ McArdle, visual arts curator Brian Hegarty/33-45, Drogheda Classical Music Series and Boyne Trad Fest. Aligned with the Late-Night Events strategy this will further provide new & engaging night time cultural experiences in Drogheda from 10pm - 12.15am across public & shared spaces, whilst supporting artists and creatives.

1) NIGHT MOVES: Visual Arts Trail Starting at Droichead Arts Centre, Barlow House on Narrow West Street and Opening for Night Moves, Culture Night’, thirtythree-45 in association with Droichead arts Centre present 'The Kiosk’ ,a new pop-up gallery and project space. The Kiosk officially opens on 'Culture Night 2024' with the exhibition 'PAUSE', a mini retrospective showcasing eight years of thirtythree-45 by artist Brian Hegarty. Leading on from the ‘Kiosk’ to Barlow House, 8 Fold Artist Studios will host a group exhibition featuring work from Vivienne Byrne, Rodney Thornton, Dee Walsh, Nuala Early, Brian Hegarty and Kieran McNulty. Across Narrow West St. our visual arts trail continues featuring the film Vernacular Dreamscapes: Nocturnal Dream Disposal by renowned German artist and musician Marc Richter. More of Marc's work will be seen on Narrow West Street leading into selected atmospheric photography using 'light and shadow' of local photographer Cathal Carolan.

Mural artist Darrin Finnegan, will create a new work on the shutters of the Abbey Shopping Centre before we pick up again with Cathal Carolan photography project at the old Choice Building.
2) NIGHT MOVES TRAD TRAIL
In partnership with Boyne Trad Fest:
Traditional late night music sessions across bars/venues in Drogheda including:
• The Punt featuring Tradify with Drogheda’s very own Darragh O’Heiligh,
• The Hole in the Wall, featuring Paddy Callahan (button accordion) & Shane McCartan (guitar)
• Clarkes Bar, featuring James McCaffrey (flute) & Mickey Curran (button accordion)
• The Mariner where Louth fiddler, composer and singer Róisín Ward Morrow will join forces with frequent collaborator Breifne Holohan (guitar, bouzouki)
• McHughs, featuring Fleadh Cheoil's 2023 Senior Duet Champions Ciara Tighe (button accordion) and Áine Murphy (fiddle), Jane Walls (uilleann pipes) & Cara Walls (harp)
• Barney Macs featuring FARÓ, an Irish music collective which celebrates Irish music and brings its language and melody to life. They will be joined Drogheda based contemporary Irish folk artist SJ McArdle.
3) NIGHT MOVES LATE NIGHT CAFÉ
Features opera, classical music and poetry, in partnership with Drogheda Classical Music Series will take place across three well loved cafe, The Coffee Box, Il Forno and Leyland Cafe

BOOKING REQUIRED FOR SOME EVENTS
fullAddress: Droichead Arts Centre Stockwell Street, Stockwell Lane, Moneymore, Drogheda, County Louth, Ireland

description:
For this year’s Culture Night, Friday 20 Sept, Artform School of Art invites you to an art exhibition in its home village of Dunmore East, Co. Waterford set in the relaxed and welcoming ambience of The Strand Inn.

The exhibition showcases exuberant abstract work by Artform tutor, artist Melissa O’Donnell, represented by Solomon Gallery in Dublin and in the new contemporary Sotheby’s 2022/23 Irish Art Sales in London and Paris.

Join artists and arts lovers all over Ireland tonight, Friday 20 September, and make your night out in Dunmore East a Culture Night with fine dining and fine art in a beautiful seaside setting.

title: Culture Night on Moore Street
description:
Celebrate Culture Night with a street party on Moore Street featuring Afro-Irish music and dance plus a late-night food and craft market. There’ll be live music by Yankari Afrobeat Collective, a groovy and energetic sound reminiscent of the Afrobeat greats of the 60s and 70s with a modern twist. Sample Nigerian street food, Brazilian churros, Romanian BBQ, Asian dumplings, Polish honey and flatbread, as well as Indian leather goods, Turkish perfumes, Ecuadorian jewellery, Peruvian trinkets, Nigerian clothing and much more.

This year’s Culture Night on Moore Street will also celebrate traders, new and original, through a newly commissioned zine. The zine will tell how all these communities came to be on Moore Street through their own stories. This is a free zine for anyone wishing to take home the magic of Moore Street. Culture Night on Moore Street will wrap up with a Moore Street inspired light projection.

locations.title: Dublin City - Monto And North Georgian Quarter

host: Traders in the Area Supporting the Cultural Quarter CLG
fullAddress: Moore Street, North City, Dublin, Ireland

title: Culture Night Shannon
description:
Shannon Community Partnership are delighted to present a series of events on Culture Night.

Drumgeely Palaza:
Dancing at the Crossroads: Live Performance by The Kirby Family at 6.45pm
The well-known Kirby family, a beloved fixture in Shannon's cultural landscape, takes the stage at the newly refurbished Drumgeely Plaza. This talented family will perform a vibrant series of instrumental Irish tunes, showcasing the rich musical heritage that has been passed down through generations. Adding to the festive atmosphere, a select group of skilled step dancers will accompany the Kirbys, performing the intricate 'flat down' technique—a cherished social tradition known for its precise and mesmerising footwork.

Choir off with Shannon Gospel Choir, Non Nobis Domine & SFRC/Creative Places at 7.30pm
This choir-off will consist of three choirs Shannon-based choirs showcasing their talents.
Shannon Gospel Choir, formed in 2009 and is widely known for its contemporary style, and lively performances that include Gospel standards and contemporary chart songs. Non Nobis Domine is a community choir based in Shannon. The choir was formed at St. Patrick's Comprehensive School in 1967. The Shannon Singers, a newly formed group of older adults facilitated by Kathleen Malone, through Creative Places Shannon and Shannon Family Resource Centre.

Christina Bennett ‘Sionna Go Breá: A Journey into Shannon's Beginnings’ 8.15-8.30pm
A captivating short art film that focuses on the early days of Shannon New Town, bringing insight to some of its original residents. This evocative film offers a glimpse into the town’s unique history and the experiences that shaped its community. This film is accompanied by a related art installation, adding a visual depth that enhances the storytelling. Created by Christina Bennett,a Shannon-based multi-disciplinary artist, whose work is deeply rooted in the stories of the communities she engages with.
• Screening: On a continuous loop from dusk (approx. 8 minutes)

Blackie O’Connell & Eoghan Neff :9:30pm - 11pm
Experience the mesmerising and powerful live performance of two extraordinary Irish musicians, Blackie O'Connell and Eoghan Neff. Hailing from Doolin, Blackie O’Connell is a virtuoso on the uilleann pipes, known for breathing new life into the rich traditions of Irish music with his remarkable skill and passion. Joining him is West Cork native Eoghan Neff, a fiddle innovator whose wild improvisations and experimental style push the boundaries of traditional music. Together, their performance is an unforgettable auditory journey, blending the past and future of Irish music in a way that cannot be missed!
fullAddress: Drumgeely, Shannon, County Clare, V14 HH01, Ireland

title: CULTURE NIGHT SWINGING 60’S IN ARDKEANE LIBRARY
description:
Step Back in Time to the Swinging 60s!

Ever danced the Hucklebuck? Grooved to The Avengers? Or simply wish you could’ve experienced the magic of the Showband era? Now’s your chance!

Join us at Ardkeen Library for a Culture Night like no other. Whether you’re reliving memories or discovering them for the first time, come along for an evening filled with fun, laughter, music, dance, and lively chat.

Bring your old photos, memorabilia, and stories—or just bring yourself. Let's make history come alive.

WLRFM's John Keane is in the DJK Booth!
fullAddress: 8 Bromley Grove, Ardkeen, Waterford, X91 KP0E, Ireland

title: Culture Night Tours of Irish Architectural Archive
description:
Take a tour of the largest terraced house on Merrion Square and learn about the work of the Irish Architectural Archive.

In the Entrance Hall, view a selection of architectural models including the Toulouse School of Economics, by Grafton Architects and ‘Babel’ by Aidan Lynam. Meanwhile, in the Architecture Gallery and on the first floor, visitors can also see the exhibition ‘Best Laid Plans’ by visual artist Mandy O'Neill and Curator Natasha Christia.

Visit the Irish Architectural Archive on Culture Night for an exclusive behind-the-scenes look into the important work of this special historical organisation.
fullAddress: Irish Architectural Archive, Merrion Square East, Dublin 2, Ireland

title: Culture Night with Craobh Caiseal Mumhan CCÉ
description:
Craobh Caiseal Mumhan CCÉ will host their annual Culture Night evening of song, dance and recitals featuring our Craobh Caiseal Mumhan CCÉ students, tutors with local musicians/artists from various cultural backgrounds. Performing together on the stage at Brú Ború in a wonderful showcase of talent, sharing stories, song and tradition, and helping to forge relationships with new communities in our locality.

This year the highlights will include our Pléaracha group of 45 students who competed in the Comhaltas Ceol an Gheimhridh competition, as well as our County Finalist u-12 and u-15 céilí bands. The Federation of Indian Communities in Ireland (FICI) will wow us with their amazing dancers, and sprinkled throughout the evening there will be local artists with songs, recitals and dance. We look forward to presenting this colourful cultural evening of entertainment to you on Culture Night 2024!

description:
The Liberties Weavers is a project honouring a thousand years of textile and weaving heritage in The Liberties Dublin and breathing life into weaving in its historic centre.

Members of The Liberties Weavers welcome the public to their space at the Timberyard for Culture Night Dublin 2024. Visitors will have the chance to see informal weaving demonstrations, as well as group artworks. A new selection of short films from Tipperary film-makers for Culture Night. We’ll see the films and chat to the makers and there may be some time for a cup of coffee too.

title: Culture Tour & Walk of Sculptures of Kilkenny City with artist and curator Mary Doyle Burke
description:
Join local artist and curator, Mary Doyle Burke, this Culture Night 24, on a Culture tour and walk around the sculptures throughout Kilkenny city.

Mary Doyle Burke will guide the participants on a walk around the city to view and discuss the sculpture. It will begin outside her Art Studios (No 10, The Parade, Kilkenny) at the Parade, go through Kilkenny Castle Grounds taking in the sculpture outdoors. Participants will then walk down by the Canal to view the sculpture at the Canal Square, and onto the outdoor sculpture at Butler Gallery yard, down by the Courthouse and up towards St Canice’s. This will be the main route with others added.

Along the walk, participants will be given charcoal and pencils with clipboards and Fabriano paper and will be encouraged to sketch some aspects of the sculptures that they are drawn to.

The tour will end at An Chead Tine Art Gallery, Dunnes Stores, Kilkenny at 6pm. Participants will be given a signed, hand drawn map of the tour that was undertaken.

This tour is open to all ages, children, families and adults and is free, but must be booked through Eventbrite. Search: “Culture Tour & Walk of the Sculpture throughout Kilkenny city with artist & Curator Mary Doyle Burke.”
fullAddress: De La Salle House, The Parade, Gardens, Kilkenny, Ireland

title: Cultured Mo
description:
Cultured Mo will be an exciting and free event held at Dundalk’s beloved pub Mo Chara as part of Culture Night 2024. This immersive celebration will spotlight three talented visual artists and a renowned musician from Dundalk, thanks to the support of Louth County Council and the Arts Council.

Local artists Colleen Eilís and Aoife Edwards will transform Mo Chara’s outdoor space with a captivating site-specific art installation, featuring an interactive piece which attendees can add to throughout the evening. From 7-9pm, Eilís and Edwards will also host a Pop-Up Print event, offering visitors a hands-on experience in screen printing, allowing them to create and take home a personalized item.

Adding to the creative atmosphere, local tattoo artist and designer Martyna Maselskyte (Mellowface) will set up a Pop-Up Tattoo Studio, offering unique, event-specific flash tattoos for those eager to expand their collections.

The night will crescendo with a live performance by Dundalk’s own Ae Mak, who will take the main stage at 9:30pm. Known for her vibrant and powerful live shows, Ae Mak will deliver her distinct art pop sound, marking the Irish premiere of her latest EP ABC Side Baby.
fullAddress: Roden Place, Townparks, Dundalk, County Louth, Ireland

genres.title: Visual Arts (Painting, Photography, Sculpture, Digital Art, Print, Etc)

title: Cultures of Edenderry
description: You are invited to Cultures of Edenderry – an evening celebrating the diverse cultures and nationalities of Edenderry at the GAA Club. It will be an opportunity for local people to showcase and sample some of the distinct cultural activities and produce from Ireland and around the world. Come and explore our food, fashion, music and much more! Everyone is welcome to come along during the evening and discover the diversity of cultural offerings in Edenderry.
fullAddress: Edenderry GAA, Ladies Football & Camogie Club, Carrick Rd, Edenderry, County Offaly, Ireland

title: Cupán Tae sa Chistin
description:
Rosemarie Langtry’s exhibition will display ways to recycle, repurpose and reuse china cups, mugs or teapots. The purpose of this new artwork is to start a conversation about the Irish welcome and the importance of the cupán tae, its welcome and comfort in many situations.

Rosemarie also wishes to address environmental issues and strike up a conversation on her passion for recycling and repurposing, encouraging others to do likewise. The exhibition will be open from 7pm. Music, storytelling and dance will commence at 8.30pm and continue throughout the night until 10pm.

Commission funded by Offaly County Council Arts Office
fullAddress: Tullaghbeg, County Offaly, N37 XV80, Ireland

genres.title: Visual Arts (Painting, Photography, Sculpture, Digital Art, Print, Etc)

title: Curragh Chronicles, Heritage Keeping with Uisce Domhain
description:
Last year we successfully produced a short ﬁlm and held a screening for Culture Night, 'Our Treasure, The Curragh of Kildare'. This achievement motivated us to apply for the Heritage Keepers course for 2024, which we completed with the Burren Beo trust of the Heritage Council. As part of our “actions” we are producing a podcast series, one of the course outcomes. For Culture night 2024 we plan to host Curragh Chronicles, Uisce Domhain Curragh Heritage Keepers; discussion and digital exhibition and record the discussions as an episode.

This podcast series along with other projects we have undertaken as Heritage Keepers will be published on our developing website. We will be recording the series in many places and spaces all centred around the Curragh, including some “ﬁreside chats” in the Croft Inn to chronicle The Curragh.

This podcast episode, Curragh Culture Night, will cover various aspects of the Curragh of Kildare including cultural, environmental, natural and built heritage, surrounding the it. We will host an open panel discussion, recording the session for publication. Additionally we will issue an open call for a digital exhibition to be held in conjunction with the event, inviting creatives of all kinds and ages to share their work inspired by Curragh of Kildare. The many works will be presented in the venue including imagery connected to our Heritage Keeping through digital screens and projections.
fullAddress: Suncroft, Common South, Co. Kildare, Ireland

title: Custom House Visitor Centre Exhibition
description:
Drop in to the Custom House Visitor Centre on Culture Night for an exclusive insight into the history of this important building.

The Custom House expert tour guides will be stationed at different sections of the exhibition to give you more detailed information about the architecture and significant historical events related to the building. Explore the exhibition at your leisure and learn all about the architecture and the tumultuous history of The Custom House.

Detailed information panels, videos and interactive screens all work in harmony throughout the rest of the exhibition to bring the amazing story of The Custom House to life for self-guided visitors on Culture Night.

A full audio guide tour of the entire exhibition is available in Irish, English, French, German, Spanish, Italian and Mandarin Chinese.

Booking is not essential, but it is advised. Visitors with bookings will be given priority on the night.

locations.title: Dublin City - Trinity And The Docklands

fullAddress: Custom House Visitor Centre, Custom House Quay, North Wall, Dublin 1, Ireland

title: Cyanotype Printmaking for All Ages
description:
Cyanotype printing is a fun and creative craft that makers of all ages will enjoy. This precursor to modern photography was discovered in 1842 by Sir John Hershel, and was quickly adopted and experimented with by various artists.
Through the magic of science, you can create incredible artworks with this alternative photography technique, with plenty of opportunities to experiment and get creative.

Participants will use leaves, feathers and other objects to create their own unique print that they can take home and frame. Participants may also bring personal items such as keyrings, toys or ornaments to use.
fullAddress: The Square, Tuam, H54 XD61

genres.title: Visual Arts (Painting, Photography, Sculpture, Digital Art, Print, Etc)

title: Dá mbeadh mileoidean agamsa
description:
D’fhéadfá a rá gurb é an mileoidean uirlis thraidisiúnta Chonamara, cé nach bhfuil an oiread sin daoine óga a chasadh ar an aimsir seo. Chuige sin, tabharfar ardán don mhileoidean ag ócáid cheiliúrtha agus feasachta a bheas á heagrú ag Ceoltóirí Óga Chois Fharraige i gcomhar le Comharchumann Sailearna Teo mar chuid den Oíche Chultúir. Beidh trí chuid san ócáid agus deis ag an bpobal freastal ar a rogha ceann, nó orthu ar fad.
1. Seisiún ‘Bain Ceol As’ mar a mbeidh deis ag ceoltóirí óga formán a bhaint as an uirlis, faoi stiúir cheoltóirí mileoidin.
2. Pléifidh painéal aíonna, faoi stiúir áisitheora, gnéithe de cheol na huirlise agus a bhfuil i ndán di sa cheantar. Tabharfar aird faoi leith ar thuairimí na n-óg.
3. Taispeántas Mileoidin. Scoth an cheoil agus an damhsa le cleachtóirí áitiúla agus na haíonna speisialta, Diarmuid Ó Meachair agus Brian McGrath.

(Beidh gá clárú don seisiún ‘Bain Ceol As’. Chun áit a dheimhniú, seol ríomhphost chuig ceoltoiriogachoisfharraige@gmail.com)
venueName: Seanscoil Sailearna, Na hAille, Indreabhán, Co. na Gaillimhe.
fullAddress: Seanscoil Sailearna, Na hAille, Indreabhán, Co. na Gaillimhe.

title: Dá mbeadh Mileoidean agamsa- Ceolchoirm
description:
Cé go bhfuil an-rath ar chúrsaí ceoil i gceantar Chois Fharraige, shílfeá go bhfuil an mileoidean ligthe i ndearmad ag an nglúin óg! Chuige sin, tabharfar ardán d’uirlis thraidisiúnta Chonamara ag ócáid cheiliúrtha agus feasachta a bheas á heagrú ag Ceoltóirí Óga Chois Fharraige i gcomhar le Comharchumann Sailearna Teo mar chuid den Oíche Chultúir. Beidh trí chuid san ócáid agus an deis ag an bpobal freastal ar a rogha ceann, nó orthu ar fad.
1. Seisiún ‘Bain Trial As’ mar a mbeidh deis ag ceoltóirí óga casadh le ceoltóirí aitheanta, greim a fháil ar an uirlis agus bunteicnící a shealbhú.
2. Fóram ina bpléifear a bhfuil i ndán don mhileoidean sa cheantar. Beidh na cleachtóirí féin lárnach sa phlé agus tabharfar aird faoi leith ar thuairimí na n-óg.
3. Taispeántas Mileoidin. Scoth an cheoil agus an damhsa le cleachtóirí áitiúla agus na haíonna speisialta, Diarmuid Ó Meachair agus Brian McGrath.
venueName: Amharclann Chois Fharraige, Na hAille, Indreabhán, Co. na Gaillimhe, H91 W925.

title: Damai Sound Reggae at the Square
description:
The Evolution of Damai Sound started from the love of collecting, playing and producing roots reggae and dub. Damai Soundsystem was started by Bob Damai with his friend and long time collaborator Salim Dastan aka Mr Upfull. Bob landed on Irish shores in 2005 where he discovered Reggae Soundsystem Culture. It was within reggae dance culture he met Salim, an Irish-Malaysian producer and composer.

A collaboration was formed and the mighty Damai Sound was born. In the mix, bringing the mic to life is Aminah whose own soulful free-style jam complements this roots experience. The dream of Damai Soundsystem is to play the sound, with you all dancing under the moonlight in love and peace.
fullAddress: Maynooth, Co. Kildare, Ireland

title: Dámhscoil Eoghanachta
description: Ag ceiliúradh oidhreacht na filíochta ar bhaile Eoghanachta. Déanfar comóradh ar shaothar na bhfilí áitiúla a bhain le Dámhscoil Eoghanachta, ina measc Colm P. Ó hIarnáin, Maitiú Ó Maoláin, agus Éamon Ó Tuathail. Beidh filí eile an bhaile Peaits Mhicil Ó hIarnáin, Colm Ó hIarnáin, agus Páidín Póil á gceiliúradh chomh maith. Déanfaidh an Dr. Deirdre Ní Chonghaile na bhfilí Eoghanachta a chur i láthair. I ndiaidh na cainte, tionólfar teacht le chéile don phobal idir óg agus aosta ina mbeidh ceol, amhráin agus damhsa le Deirdre agus cairde. Beidh fáilte speisialta roimh cheoltóirí óga a n-uirlisí a thabhairt leo agus páirt a ghlacadh. Beidh an ócáid ar fad trí mheán na Gaeilge – Cuirfear meascán scéalaíocht, filíocht, amhránaíocht agus ceol ar fáil. Is as an oileán ó dhúchas í an Dr Deirdre Ní Chonghaile agus go leor cáil uirthi i dtaobh stair, oidhreacht, amhránaíocht srl. Tá a lán duaiseanna agus cáilíochtaí bainte amach aici chomh maith.
venueName: Ionad Oideachais & Teeanga Árann, Eoghanacht, Árainn, Cuan na Gaillimhe. H91Y3E5
fullAddress: Ionad Oideachais & Teeanga Árann, Eoghanacht, Árainn, Cuan na Gaillimhe. H91Y3E5

title: Dance Cork Firkin Crane – Crane Visual Exhibition – Possible Life
description:
Join us as we open the doors to our current Crane Visual exhibition a little later than usual to celebrate Culture Night 2024. Take the opportunity to visit the exhibition and view the art works. The exhibition curator, Dermot Browne, will be on hand during the evening.

Crane Visual, curated by Dermot Browne, is located in the Musgrave Theatre at Dance Cork Firkin Crane. The current exhibition Possible Life is a series of large ‘punk zen’ Indian brush drawings on water colour paper by artist Chris Doris.

These large circular works of art are ambiguous, alluding to cellular and planetary cosmic fields of becoming. The images are informed by the artist’s long experience as a meditator and psychotherapist in Western and Buddhist psychology. The works rest on the contemplative seeing of somatic and cosmic fields – macro and micro.
fullAddress: Firkin Crane-Dance Cork, John Redmond Street, Shandon, Cork, Ireland

title: DANCEHALL BLUES by David Bolger
description:
DANCEHALL BLUES investigates the blurred, vanishing line between fiction and non-fiction. Directed and choreographed by David Bolger, this show unites two of Ireland's most exciting performers, Stephanie Dufresne and Alex O’Neill for the very first time – in an intimate duet that grooves between hope and the dystopia of an angry world.

It's 2024 and the witching hour. As dusk approaches, the doors of the hall are flung wide open. You are invited to enter. Two enigmatic dancers hit the dance floor – quietly questioning their hopes and dreams amongst the surrounding turmoil. As their shadows deepen, they take more chances and dance more dances – “where are we headed to, where does it all end?”
fullAddress: CoisCéim Dance Theatre, Fairview Strand, Clontarf West, Dublin 3, D03 YV62, Ireland

title: Danescastle Music Group a Library Performance
description:
We are delighted to announce that the Danecastle Music Group will be performing in the New Ross Library for Culture Night. Established the late 1970s by Martha Torpey and John Marshall, this award winning group has gone from strength to strength since its inception. Join us for what should prove to be a riveting performance by these talented musicians.

Booking essential contact the library at newrosslibrary@wexfordcoco.ie or call 051 421877.
fullAddress: New Ross Library, Barrack Lane, Pondfields, New Ross, County Wexford, Ireland

title: Dara String Ensemble
description:
Violin duet and trio music played by members of the Dara String Ensemble. An informal performance of a wide range of well-known classics from Bach's Air on a G String to John Sheehan's Marino Waltz.

This is a private event for residents of the Baltinglass Community Hospital.
fullAddress: Baltinglass District Hospital, Newtownsaunders, Baltinglass, County Wicklow, Ireland

title: DE BRUIR – Leatherwork Demonstrations
description: The DE BRUIR Atelier will be demonstrating a range of traditional and contemporary leatherworking techniques that are used in creating its collection of bags. Depending on numbers, we’ll facilitate people get hands-on with the leather and simple tooling themselves.
fullAddress: DE BRUIR : Leather Atelier, Monasterevin Road, Kildare, Ireland

title: Dead Interesting Tour of Glasnevin Cemetery
description:
Join an expert tour guide on a fascinating journey through the hidden depths of Glasnevin Cemetery on the Dead Interesting Tour.

The stories of a nation are held within the walls of Glasnevin Cemetery. Established in 1832 as a burial place for all people, this unique garden cemetery grew from humble origins to become Ireland’s largest and most storied cemetery.

Stroll along beautiful tree-lined paths and hear stories of both the ordinary and the extra-ordinary. This includes visits to the resting place of renowned writer Brendan Behan, poet and novelist Rosa Mulholland, as well as an insight into the earliest history of Glasnevin with their first burial, young Michael Carey in February 1832.

With 1.5 million people buried in Glasnevin, every plot has a story.
fullAddress: Experience Glasnevin - Ireland's National Cemetery, Finglas Road, Glasnevin, Dublin, Ireland

title: Deaf Girl Music
description:
What does it mean to grow up deaf in a middle-class irish family which derives its status from impeccable musicianship? How can one emulate Whitman and ""sing oneself"", when speaking out is dangerous?

This theatrical adaptation of the poetry of local poet Denise Garvey combines poetic text with live performance & musicianship to innovate new ways of delivering literary work. It is
a preview of a longer piece currently in development, and explores themes of belonging, patriarchy, difference, striving, and the fertile place where language, music and embodiment intersect.

As a theatre director, Sarah O'Toole enjoys working with ensemble performers to find unique ways of staging poetry. Thanks to an Arts Council Agility Award, she and four actor-musicians spent a weekend earlier this year exploring performance approaches to Denise's work, and we are very looking forward to giving audiences a taste of our explorations upstairs at The Mick Lally Theatre at 8pm on Culture Night.

We are very grateful to Galway City Council & The Mick Lally Theatre & Kumon City West for their support in delivering this exciting cross-disciplinary event.
fullAddress: The Mick Lally Theatre, Druid Lane, Galway, Ireland

title: Dear Boobs; We Act Breast Together!
description:
Breast cancer survivors or "breasties" Helen Fahey and Megan Flynn Dixon will host an evening of creativity and fun at Gort Cancer Support Centre. Aimed at survivors, previvors, patients undergoing active treatment, their families and supporters, this is an opportunity to explore the ways in which the arts can lift our spirits and feed our souls during and after a breast cancer diagnosis in a safe and supportive space.

A relaxed and casual evening with paint, prose, prosecco and aperitivo! This event will allow participants to find hope and friendship among founding members of breast cancer support group, Tough Titties, and the wider breast cancer community.
fullAddress: Ballyhugh, County Galway, H91 WFP8

genres.title: Visual Arts (Painting, Photography, Sculpture, Digital Art, Print, Etc)

title: Deirdre Fox
description:
Deirdre, a versatile singer/songwriter and performer, captivates audiences with a mix of covers and her own compositions. Last year, she showcased four of her original pieces at the Listening Rooms event in Cavan Town's Multisound.
Currently, she is immersed in the creative process, recording fresh tracks anticipated for upcoming release. Stay tuned for her new material, all welcome!
fullAddress: 92 Main Street, Abbeyland, Cavan, Ireland

title: Demystifying “No Blade of Grass: Strontium Dog”: An Evening with Austin Ivers.
description:
Join us at The Cash Shop on Culture Night for an engaging experience with established video installation artist Austin Ivers, professor at The School of Design and Creative Arts based on ATU Galway City campus. Ivers will be guiding tours of his solo show throughout the evening, offering insightful commentary on his creative process and the themes explored in his work. Walk-through tours will be available in small groups and one-on-one, fostering a personalised and interactive environment for all visitors.

This event is designed to make contemporary art more accessible and enjoyable, particularly for those who may not be regular attendees of such exhibitions. Ivers will be happy to answer questions and spark meaningful conversations about the works on display.

Open to all ages and with a relaxed atmosphere, this is a fantastic opportunity for the greater Gort community to engage with the world of video art. The Cash Shop's doors will be open from 6pm to 9pm on Culture Night – no booking required!
fullAddress: The Cash Shop, Bridge St., Gort, Co. Galway H91VH21

genres.title: Visual Arts (Painting, Photography, Sculpture, Digital Art, Print, Etc)

title: Deoraí
description: Tá na healaíontóirí Con Horgan agus Hannes Jung chun píosa nua amharclannaíocht sráide a chruthú. Píosa phromanáid sráide sa Daingean d’Oíche Chultúr 2024. Tá Hannes chun culaith pyro a chruthú. Is féidir leis an chulaith seo bheith trí thine (go sábháilte!) ag siúl timpeall an bhaile. An cúis taobh thiar an t-éacht nó go bhfuil suim ag Fanzini ceisteanna a chur os comhair an lucht féachana faoi dhifríocht, an strainséir agus daoine difriúil ó áiteanna éagsúla.

title: Deoraí The Wanderer
description:
Fanzini will showcase a dramatic & arresting piece of street arts, Deoraí, the Wanderer, featuring a solo performer on fire.

This event will take place under the cover of darkness and the streets and public space of Dingle will become the stage.

Fanzini Productions will explore the concept of the other, the stranger, the blow-in creating this spectacular show in the public space.

Con Horgan of Fanzini Productions will create an original soundscape composition for the piece "
fullAddress: Dingle, County Kerry, Ireland

title: DEREK ROONEY & FRIENDS
description: Derek Rooney will be performing. Come along o listen and sing along to great music. Derek and friends will keep you entertained on Culture Night. Sing along and enjoy the atmosphere of the Tara Arms.
fullAddress: The Tara Arms Bar & Lazy River Cafe, Church Street, Tullow, County Carlow, Ireland

title: Derry Girls Panel Discussion
description:
Come join us for a panel discussion about the hit TV show, Derry Girls! This event will feature original Derry Girl Shauna Bray, award winning co host of the "Talking Derry Girls Podcast" Pauline Moore and Dr. John Kavanagh from the University of Ulster sharing behind-the-scenes stories and insights. Chairing the event will be award winning BBC Presenter and Producer Marie-Louise Kerr. The Tower Museum is the place to be for all Derry Girls fans this culture night!

Refreshments and a free tour of the exhibition will be available after the event
fullAddress: Tower Museum, Union Hall Place, Londonderry BT48 6LU, UK

title: Did You Make That Yourself
description:
An Open Evening of interest at Number 19 Craft and Design, you never know who you might meet at 'Did you make that yourself?'

The Makers Co Operative Number 19 Craft and Design will bring a sampling of stories from their studios.
With the lights on til 9pm, call and ask all your crafty questions, with skills from textiles to fine art, jewellery and ceramics, we have it covered.
venueName: Number 19 Craft and Design, The Craft Village
fullAddress: Londonderry BT48 6AR, UK

title: Discover the World of Film Classification
description:
IFCO will open its doors once again this Culture Night, inviting the public into their office to learn about the world of film classification. Participants are invited to view and classify a short film with an official Film Classifier at the small cinema onsite. A great deal of consideration goes into each classification decision made by the Office and IFCO are delighted to have the opportunity to share this process.

The screening will be followed by a discussion with the audience about the guidelines that underpin all these decisions, and how, and why a particular age rating would be applied. IFCO are excited to share an insight into their work with the public for Culture Night. Audience input is always welcome - and there will be popcorn at the ready!

locations.title: Dublin City - Phoenix Park And Museum Quarter

fullAddress: Irish Film Classification Office, Blackhall Walk, Smithfield, Dublin, Ireland

title: Discovering Recovery: Open House with BCAT | We Act
description:
Bray Community Addiction Team (BCAT) is hosting “Discovering Recovery: Open House with BCAT” an event designed to engage the community, raise awareness about addiction, and showcase the essential services provided by Bray Community Addiction Team (BCAT).

This event will feature music from BCAT’s Music Group (Finding Your Voice), food, an art exhibition, and guided tours of our facility, offering a comprehensive look into our services and the impact of our work. This will be a collaborative event with other local community-based projects.

BCAT is a unique community-owned, low-threshold service that provides a welcoming, non-judgmental, and confidential environment. We offer appropriate services to individuals (adults and children), families, and the wider community experiencing drug and alcohol problems and those affected by substance use and addiction issues. We meet people wherever they are on their journey and in whatever circumstances.

"Discovering Recovery: Open House with BCAT" will be an inspiring and engaging event that brings the community together to support BCAT. By combining music, food, art, and tours, we aim to create a memorable experience that raises awareness, celebrates recovery, and enhances community visibility for addiction services in Bray. This event seeks to reduce the stigma associated with addiction and foster stronger community links.

For any queries please email Zoe Donnelly on zdonnelly@bcat.ie
fullAddress: 4B Dublin Road, Little Bray, Bray, Co. Wicklow, A98 K718, Ireland

title: Discovery Session with the Historical Harp Society of Ireland
description:
Join the Historical Harp Society of Ireland at the National Museum of Ireland - Archaeology and celebrate Ireland’s illustrious, ancient (wire-strung) harp this Culture Night. During this discovery workshop, visitors can hear pieces played by musicians, learn all about the history of the ancient Irish harp, and then have a go at playing it themselves. No harp experience is required for this workshop.

Schedule:

18:00 - Listen to this rare instrument being played in concert
18:30 - Learn all about its fascinating history in an illustrated talk
19:00 - Have a go yourself in a hands-on workshop (limited places)

This event is now booked out, however interested audiences can follow the Eventbrite link below to join the waitlist.

There are limited places for the ‘Have a Go’ session of this workshop. If you would like to take part in this element, please contact the Historical Harp Society of Ireland on info@irishharp.org or 086 8623430 to book.
fullAddress: National Museum of Ireland - Archaeology, Kildare Street, Dublin 2, Ireland

title: Distillery Tour: See Where Stillgarden Distillery Create Modern Irish Spirits
description:
Come and visit Stillgarden Distillery, the home of Modern Irish Spirits, on Culture Night this year to find out the (g)inspiration behind their range of beautifully crafted modern Irish gins. The tour will bring you around the small but perfectly formed distillery.

All sessions end with a Q&A from one of Stillgarden’s liquid experts. All tour guides are super knowledgeable about Stillgardens’ Modern Irish Spirits. Ask them about the Stillgarden company ethos, sustainability projects and zero food waste policy. Each fully guided class is 20 minutes in duration.

After the class, visitors are welcome to stay in the bar for drinks, and even partake in a game of corn-hole!
fullAddress: Stillgarden Distillery, Tyrconnell Road, Inchicore, Dublin 8, Ireland

title: Diva Voces Choir Performance at Dublin City Hall
description:
Diva Voces is a four-part female voice choir, based in the heart of our capital city. The choir, which supports women artists and performers, have developed an extensive repertoire, ranging from classics and sacred music to popular anthems, traditional Irish music, gospel, swing and folk.

On Culture Night, September 20th, Diva Voces Choir will present a selection of their repertoire in the beautiful City Hall on Dame Street in Dublin 2. Come along for a memorable and dazzling performance.

locations.title: Dublin City - Liberties And Historic Quarter

description: A delightful drawing session that welcomes everyone from little doodlers to seasoned sketchers.
fullAddress: My Place, Community Centre, Mill Road, Townparks, Midleton, County Cork, Ireland

title: Donegal Chamber Orchestra
description:
Join Donegal Chamber Orchestra to experience the music of Purcell, Vivaldi, Fauré and Holst, conducted by Víctor Yélamo, with lead soloist Orsolya Szabó-Yélamo.

The Donegal Chamber Orchestra is one of the ensemble groups within the Donegal Music Education Partnership. It features classical string players from across the county and is dedicated to helping students and amateur musicians achieve the highest level of excellence in performance. It gives regular recitals throughout the county during the year, including at the annual Donegal Chamber Music Festival in October.
fullAddress: Conwal Parish Church, Letterkenny, County Donegal, Ireland

title: Donegal Youth Orchestra Open Rehearsal
description: Everyone is invited to an open rehearsal of the Donegal Youth Orchestra at the Regional Cultural Centre. Orchestra members will be working with their long-time conductor, Vincent Kennedy. This is a chance to see one of Ireland’s leading conductors at work with a group of talented young musicians from across Donegal.
fullAddress: Regional Cultural Centre, Letterkenny, Port Road, Letterkenny, County Donegal, Ireland

title: DoodleSong
description:
DoodleSong is an event for 3 to 6 year olds and their adults in which we gather to sing and take our crayons for a spin. With a paper covered floor as our artistic space we will sing songs and tell tales of ancient Ireland, of boats and voyages, of storms and magical waves.

Come and join in and see where our mark making takes us. Led by Antje Guest from Éiníní Music
fullAddress: Samara Centre Clonakilty, Casement Park, Youghals, Clonakilty, County Cork, Ireland

title: Doora-Barefield CCE Celebrate Culture Night
description: Doora-Barefield CCE celebrate Culture Night with a vibrant night of traditional music, song & dance with local musicians, singers, and dancers at Fahy Hall, Roslevan. Come and immerse yourself in the festive atmosphere and celebrate the best of Irish culture with us.
fullAddress: Rosslevan, Ennis, Co. Clare, V95 A253, Ireland

title: Draíocht & Ardú Croí le Ceol, Amhrán & Damhsa.
description: Tá sé i gceist againn ceiliúradh a dhéanamh ar an Oíche Chultúir sa Ghaeltacht le ceol traidisiúnta ach le stíl éagsúla ó David Munnelly. Tá clú agus cáil ar David Munnelly ar fud an domhain i saol an ceol, is féidir a rá go bhfuil sé ina mháistir ar an mbosca ceoil. Tugann sé croí agus beocht don cheol ar bhealach speisialta agus ina theannta sin tá sé ina mháistir ar an fhidil agus an Bozuki chomh maith. Tá an-taithí aige bheith ag casadh a chuid ceoil le DeDanann, Mary Bergin, Alec Finn Beannacht Dé leis agus go leor eile. Tá an bheirt le chéile ar nós tintreach ag seinm an cheoil. Tabharfaidh siad blas de na stíleanna éagsúla ceoil atá acu don lucht féachana. Tá Rónán Ó Conghaile i mbun damhsa sean-nós le roinnt blianta anuas, d’éirigh leis Comórtas Steip a bhaint amach ag Oireachtais na Samhna. Chomh maith le sin, bíonn Rónán ag casadh amhráin sean-nóis, tá sé ag obair ar a seacht ndícheall leis an traidisiún a choinneáil beo beathach don chéad ghlúin eile. Tá mise ag casadh amhráin ó bhí mé an-óg, tá an traidisiún tagtha anuas tríd glúnta na gCeannabháin uilig ó Mháire Ghabha & Michael Mháire Ghabha. Tá mé féin, Mick Connelly agus David Munnelly ag ceol lena chéile le bliain anuas. Rinne muid camchuairt bheag timpeall na hÉireann agus Stiúideo Cuan ina measc. Bheadh muid lán sásta an maoiniú a fháil ionas go dtig linn leanúint ar aghaidh ag ardú spiorad agus croíthe an pobal go léir.
fullAddress: Screebe House, Rosmuc, Connemara, Gaillimh.

title: Draw & Paint at The Hope Centre
description:
The Hope Centre, in partnership with Creative Places Enniscorthy, invites you to visit the Art room in the Hope Centre, Enniscorthy where the Centres resident art teachers, Lisa Rossiter and Kate Whitty, will be present to give guidance on drawing and painting.

Drop in event - No Booking Required
Free event, everyone welcome.
fullAddress: Hope Cancer Support Centre, Weafer Street, Enniscorthy, County Wexford, Ireland

genres.title: Visual Arts (Painting, Photography, Sculpture, Digital Art, Print, Etc)

title: Drawbridge Workshop
description:
This is a participatory engagement workshop in collaboration with Howff architects. The workshop aims to highlight and generate discussion on town-wide accessibility issues, starting at the front steps of Kunstverein Aughrim. Participants will assemble and test a temporary access ramp in the form of a drawbridge that can be inserted into a building's threshold. As part of the workshop, Kunstverein Aughrim and Howff will present their learning following a year-long Accessibility Study of Aughrim (titled Suppose a Stone) that encompassed a series of surveys and activity maps, a Sensory Walk, and a Walkability Study. Suppose a Stone was a collaboration between Aughrim Tidy Towns CLG, Aughrim Active Retirement Group, Kunstverein Aughrim and Howff Architects, supported by the Irish Architecture Foundation’s Reimagine Hometown Architect initiative. Findings will be shared for future learning.

This workshop takes place from 2-5 pm.

Booking will be available via Eventbrite: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/1002312843697?aff=oddtdtcreator

For any queries please see https://kunstverein.ie/Drawbridge-Workshop

Booking Email Address: office@kunstverein.ie
fullAddress: Kunstverein Aughrim, Main St, Aughrim Lower, Aughrim, Co. Wicklow, Y14 K120, Ireland

title: DRIxDDR: Athbheochan Bheo for Culture Night
description:
The Athbheochan Collective and Imbas Ióga present a live performance night of Gaelic revivalism and international solidarity, supported by Dublin Digital Radio, the Digital Repository of Ireland and The Oireachtas.

The night will feature a yogic journey as gaeilge, presented by Bláthnaid Ní Smaoiaigh (Imbas Ióga) and later, music, poetry and a live jam session from Comhcheol - a group of musicians in the Direct Provision system who are collaborating with Irish musicians. This programme has been curated by Blue Niall (Athbheochan/DDR).

Running Order:
18:30 Yoga with Imbas Ióga (ticketed)
19:45 Live Music with Comhcheoil (all welcome, no ticket needed)

title: Drop-in ‘Myths and Monstrosities’ Workshop at Luan Gallery
description:
In this drop-in workshop, participants will be guided in creating their own figurine of a monster or mythical creature using craft materials. Responding to the themes of “the monstrous other” and mythology present in Kevin Mooney’s exhibition Tuberclerosies, participants will engage in critical discussion with the facilitator about the concept of monstrosity and the use of myth in our everyday.

title: Drop-In Art Workshop: Landmarks, Memory and the City
description:
Drop in to Temple Bar Gallery + Studios on Culture Night for a workshop exploring themes of Landmarks, Memory and the City.

Meet artists Jialin Long and Paula Erraught, try out ideas and make art in a studio environment. The workshop will encourage visitors to think about all the many different people moving through our city that landmarks, such as the Ha’penny Bridge, hold in their history. Using 'flags' as the inspiration, explore what it means to use fabric to make art and to convey a message. Try out printing, painting and drawing on fabric to contribute to a collective conversation and artwork.

This workshop continues the conversation of Jialin Long’s public artwork 'Landmark as Witness', comprising five flags on Wellington Quay, flying for the month of September.

All ages welcome. Children must be accompanied by a parent/guardian.

Whether you're a seasoned drummer or a curious beginner, this event promises a hands-on experience with the Bodhrán, as well as insights into the rich traditions of drumming from various cultures. Trish has prepared a kit for each attendee to use and to keep to practice at home. Booking is essential as it is a first come first served basis with a maximum of 15 people. No need to bring anything except yourself and refreshments!

title: Dublin Camera Club Exhibition of Photography
description:
In operation since 1945, the Dublin Camera Club is the oldest and largest camera club in Ireland. Bringing together photographers of all ages and abilities, it offers its members a dedicated club premises in Dublin city centre, including a gallery, studio, darkroom, library and meeting rooms, a year-round programme of lectures, competitions and workshops, an excellent Beginners Photography course, high quality exhibitions by club, national and international photographers, an annual exhibition of members work and specialist workshop meetings for novices and for those interested in nature photography and documentary/street photography.

Over the years, many of its members have been awarded for their photographic work. Its gallery on the ground floor of its premises on Camden Street has ongoing exhibitions of members' work as well as works from other great photographers. Drop in on Culture Night to view their current exhibition and find out more about the club, which celebrated its 75th Anniversary in 2020.

The photos, centred around Dublin city centre, will show key places where James Joyce might have walked like Stephens Green and buildings around it like the Shelbourne Hotel.

title: Dublin Painting and Sketching Club 146th Annual Exhibition
description:
2024 marks the 150th Anniversary of the Dublin Painting and Sketching Club. This year to celebrate this milestone there will be live painting demonstrations from some of its members on Culture Night.

The total membership of Dublin Painting and Sketching Club exceeds 80 and while the majority come from the Dublin area, there are members from all parts of the island of Ireland. To attract new talent, the Committee has, since 2016, operated an Open Submission system. This is the 8th year of our Open Call from which a number of non-members have been selected to exhibit in our Annual Exhibition. Those selected are also eligible for our annual Open Submission prize of €500.

The work of Dublin Painting and Sketching Club members embraces all mediums and styles, within the broad genre of representational art. Come and join them on Culture Night as they celebrate this historic milestone with an exhibition and live demonstrations.

title: Dublin Port Bus Tour
description:
Join this unique and insightful bus tour on Culture Night with Lar Joye, the Port Heritage Director at Dublin Port Company. Explore the fascinating history of Dublin as a natural port and its profound impact on the city’s development, culture, and heritage.

On this tour, Lar Joye will guide you through the significant landmarks and stories of Dublin's maritime past. Discover how the port influences the growth of the city, its industries, and the daily lives of its people and how Dublin's identity has long been shaped by its waterside gateway.

title: Dublin Riots – What Happened?
description: The Dublin riots, a boiling point in contemporary Irish society, sparked conversations amongst a group of playwrights called I Nua, who meet in the Irish Writers Centre monthly about the importance of creating and performing stories that reflect these turbulent times that will be noted in history. The 'Dublin Riot - What Happened?' show, is the result, and aims to capture the raw emotions and experiences from that night through a series of theatrical performances. These pieces are a direct response to the riots, offering a provocative and timely reflection on this painful event - diverse performances, including monologues, duologues, poetry, and short plays.

title: Dul na Síochána
description:
True peace is not merely the absence of tension. It is the presence of justice
Martin Luther King, Jr.

This is a dance event/workshop led by Bernadette Divilly, dance movement artist who specialises in socially-engaged practices centred on the body-mind relationship.

This event involves audience engagement and participation in investigating the conditions essential for the presence of peace. It includes somatic explorations, improvisational dance scores and deep listening. We will contemplate what it means to do no harm. We will explore breathable boundaries, power, language differences and cultural conditions.

Audience engagement is central and participatory every step of the way, focusing on connection between the human nervous system and co-creating through movement. We will investigate how an exploration of knowing justice is essential to our health, wellbeing and survival while honouring that we are all interconnected.

Some parts of the event will be documented and shared digitally.

Supported by Galway Dance

Come and meet us to see photographs and mementos of great Legion personalities, such as Edel Quinn and Alfie Lambe.

title: Éagsúlacht sa Chlár – Celebrating Cultural Diversity in Clare.
description:
Éagsúlacht sa Chlár offers new communities in County Clare the opportunity to showcase their unique cultures while also experiencing the diverse traditions of others, including Irish culture. This special night creates a space for contact between different cultures and encourages integration in a very informal and friendly way, leading to a better understanding of our similarities despite our cultural uniqueness.
Music, art, and song are integral parts of all cultures, and Culture Night is the perfect opportunity to celebrate these universal forms of expression. It's a chance for everyone to come together, share their heritage, and learn from one another in a fun and engaging environment.
Don't miss out on this incredible event that brings people together and promotes unity through the celebration of culture. Join us for an unforgettable night of cultural exchange and make new connections with people from all walks of life.

title: Earthquakes & Other Geohazards
description: DIAS Geophysics opens its door for Culture Night, inviting visitors to learn more about how Ireland holds a special place in the history of Earthquake Studies, thanks to the pioneering work of Robert Mallet. Mallet was a mid-19th century engineer from Dublin who studied earthquakes and volcanoes, producing the first artificial seismic waves at Killiney in 1849, and coined the term 'epicentre' for the point on the ground above the earthquake! Meet the dedicated scholars and staff of DIAS Geophysics who will be on hand to answer your questions and learn about the past and the present of live, worldwide earthquake monitoring in the heart of Dublin.

title: Eason Presents: Chris Haughton in Conversation
description:
Eason and DK are delighted to present Chris Haughton in conversation with Shane Hegarty to celebrate Culture Night in Eason, O'Connell Street. Chris will be discussing his newest book- his first foray into non-fiction - 'The History of Information'.

'The History of Information' is an utterly unique book that explains how the ways we share, and store information have shaped and changed the world - from the very first mark on a cave wall 50,000 years ago, through to the powerful AI which informs how we communicate and record information today.

The event is free to attend with copies of ‘The History of Information’ available to purchase in-store on the night.

title: Echoes of the Ocean, Culture Night at Galway Atlantaquaria
description:
Galway Atlantaquaria is delighted to support the national, annual Culture Night experience: One Night For All.

Echoes of the Ocean is a marine themed musical experience that celebrates our music and connection to the sea. This is an ideal event for all ages, and we can’t wait to hear the performances of The Fleadhwers, O’Malley Trad, and Eugene Lambe.

Also included in the night's events will be fun activities for children such as scavenger hunts and workshops.

We are inviting the public to visit the aquarium on Friday the 20th of September from 6pm until 8pm.

Why Attend?
Culture Night is a truly packed night of experiences, there is so much to choose from but the Aquarium in Galway stands out from the rest as it tells a story of the marine life that surrounds our island. Our Aquarium features interesting exhibits, and a host of experiences that showcase the beautiful biodiversity of life in our rivers, lakes, and ocean. We have featured talks and feeding experiences that engage, educate and inspire.

For more information and bookings, please see our website www.nationalaquarium.ie
Or call 091 585 100.

#OneNightForAll.

title: Elemental Tales 3 – Enchanted Garden
description:
“Elemental Tales 3 – Enchanted Garden” invites you on a mesmerizing journey through the verdant realm of the Hunt Museum's garden, where the lines between fantasy and reality blur into a tapestry of enchantment. This immersive promenade performance unveils four spellbinding narratives, each unfolding in distinct corners of the garden, marrying the mystique of Slavic folklore with the whimsy of Irish fairy tales.

At the heart of this year's spectacle lies an enigmatic forest kingdom besieged by turmoil, where the inhabitants—be they the elusive Kikimora, the enigmatic Baba Yaga, the guardians of the woods known as Leshy, or the playful forest fairies—beckon you to partake in their world. As the narratives intertwine, you'll find yourself drawn deeper into a realm where magic reigns supreme and every shadow hides a secret waiting to be discovered.

Step into the garden and become a part of a timeless saga where the boundaries between audience and performer dissolve, and where the collective imagination takes flight. "Elemental Tales 3 - Enchanted Garden" promises an unforgettable odyssey where folklore and fairy tales converge, inviting you to embrace the magic that unites us all.

title: Embracing Rights, Enriching Culture: #OurStoryIsOne – The Legacy of the Ten Shiraz Women
description:
‘Embracing Rights, Enriching Culture’ is an immersive exhibition, and forms part of the worldwide #OurStoryIsOne campaign inspiring artistic expressions from virtually every part of the globe.

Taking inspiration from 10 Baha’i women who were hanged one after another in Shiraz, Iran on June, 18th 1983 because they refused to renounce their beliefs, this heroic story serves as a powerful emblem of the long struggle for equality and justice lived by women and men of all faiths and backgrounds - a struggle that continues today.

The #OurStoryIsOne campaign has been running for over a year and has inspired thousands of pieces of art. The global outpouring of artwork in response to the story of these women - one only 17 when she died - frames human rights not just as legal concepts but as essential pillars of our personal and cultural identity and creative expression.

title: Empathising with the Enemy
description:
NCAD Gallery is delighted to introduce lens-based artist, photographer and maker Louis Scully with his first solo exhibition titled Empathising with the Enemy.

Empathising with the Enemy by Scully is a lens-based project and film work developed through forging a network of individuals and organisations located in the geographic areas of Palestine and Israel - made manifest through a dialogical approach of interviewing activists' of varying communities who voice their wider perspectives' from within the contested occupied territories of Israel-Palestine.

The original film work, filmed in March-April 2024, features nine Palestinian and Israeli activist interviews' that include interviewees: Noor A’Wad, Tom Mehager, Naser Odat, Mohamad Jamous, Ofer Shorr, Rana Salman, Danielle Cantor, Rav Hanan Schlesinger and Or.

Curated by Anne Kelly, NCAD Gallery.

title: Engage Art Studios Open Studios & Artist Showcase
description:
We invite audiences to visit our artists’ studios in our Churchfields premises for Culture Night 2024. The Open Studios event aims to give visitors an insight into the workspace of the typical artist working in Galway in a designated visual art studio organization.

Audiences will catch a glimpse behind the scenes of the artist studio and have the opportunity to meet with and chat to working artists to discuss their practice. Alongside this our Orbital members and other studio members who work in studios outside of our main premises will exhibit some of their most recent artworks and/or works in progress in our gallery space on site.

We will also be displaying some artwork of the children who participate in our regular art workshops as part of the showcase.

title: English Market – Open Evening with Tastings, & Music
description:
The historic English Market, the renowned city centre cultural landmark, for one night of the year only; will open it's doors to celebrate Culture Night from 6pm to 9pm.

A selection of English Market traders will be open exclusively, serving traditional tastes and local treats, ranging from handmade sushi rolls to local cheese and charcuterie, wine tasting and samples of traditional Cork favourites.

Local musicians will enhance the already vibrant atmosphere of the market for the occasion.
fullAddress: English Market, Centre, Cork, Ireland

title: Enniscorthy Arts and Culture Festival Launch
description:
The launch event of the inaugural Enniscorthy Arts & Culture Festival takes place at Enniscorthy Castle at 8pm, followed by the premiere of Forbidden Bonds, a short film based on the Normans and Enniscorthy Castle.

This will be the first screening of film Forbidden Bonds by Wexford Film Workshop based on the Prendergast Norman family who built Enniscorthy Castle circa 1240 - it is filmed in locations all around Enniscorthy and at Enniscorthy Castle with local actors and re-enactors and is a tale of love, murder, and intrigue. All Welcome

The Enniscorthy Arts & Culture Festival takes place from 20th - 23rd September and will bring book launches by local writers, exhibitions of local art, pop up poetry and spoken word, local comedians, and drama workshops to audiences. Check out their social media for updates.
fullAddress: Enniscorthy Castle, Castle Hill, Enniscorthy, County Wexford, Ireland

title: Eóin Dooley: No Sympathy Book Launch
description:
No Sympathy is the debut novel from Tullamore-based author Eóin Dooley. A fresh, philosophical take on urban fantasy, it follows Theo as he alienates the last of his friends in Berlin and is summarily kicked out onto the street. Unbeknownst to him, by cutting the last of his social ties he accidentally falls into a world of magic, allowing him to immediately transport himself anywhere across the globe.

Eóin’s work has featured in publications by Solar Press Books, Manawaker Studio, and Elegant Literature Magazine. No Sympathy was published in August by Android Press.
fullAddress: Tullamore, County Offaly, R35 NY50, Ireland

title: Eoin Ryan – Trawled, When Adventure Becomes Survival
description:
Hinterland Festival presents "Eoin Ryan - Trawled, When Adventure Becomes Survival". A true story you will never forget sees Eoin Ryan bring his one man show to Kells. This raw, exuberant true story of adventure, set on the Coral Sea in Australia, twists dramatically into survival, culminating in an unforgettable moment of redemptive grace.

Ready to come onboard?

title: Escape Room Session 1: Library’s History and Collections
description:
Instituto Cervantes, the official organisation for the promotion of Spanish language and culture, invites young people and adults to a thrilling evening at their library. Located on the first floor, the library boasts over 11,000 volumes celebrating the richness of the Spanish-speaking world.

On Culture Night, the library will host an exciting Escape Room in two sessions. In the first session, participants will delve into the library’s history and collections, uncovering fascinating intersections between Irish and Hispanic cultures.

This activity promises a fun and educational experience, offering insights into the cultural wealth of the library while challenging problem-solving skills in an interactive way.

locations.title: Dublin City - Trinity And The Docklands

fullAddress: Instituto Cervantes, Lincoln Place, Dublin 2, Ireland

title: Escape Room, Session 2: Gustavo Adolfo Bécquer’s Mistery Legend
description:
Instituto Cervantes, the official organisation for the promotion of Spanish language and culture, invites young people and adults to a thrilling evening at their library. Located on the first floor, the library boats over 11,000 volumes celebrating the richness of the Spanish-speaking world.

On Culture Night, the library will host an exciting Escape Room in two sessions. In the second session, dive into a captivating mystery legend by the renowned Spanish 19th-century writer Gustavo Adolfo Bécquer. As you immerse yourself in the narrative, you will find yourself unravelling puzzles inspired by Bécquer’s mysterious atmosphere. This Escape Room is designed to be an engaging and educational experience, testing your problem-solving abilities while bringing Bécquer’s legendary storytelling to life.

locations.title: Dublin City - Trinity And The Docklands

title: Evensong at Saint Patrick’s Cathedral
description:
All are welcome to experience Culture Night at the iconic Saint Patrick's Cathedral with Choral Evensong, a harmonious blend of song and worship where tradition meets community and history meets culture.

The renowned choir will guide you through an evening of reflection and inspiration, set against the backdrop of stunning stained glass and soaring arches. Evensong transcends time, uniting generations through music and spirituality. Whether you seek inspiration or a moment of respite, come along for an unforgettable Evensong, celebrating the enduring beauty of Saint Patrick's Cathedral.

title: Everyman Theatre – Mockie Ah! : Camp Culture
description:
Tickets for this event are sold out.

Showtime 8PM at The Everyman. 18+

Ireland's leading drag haus and pure Cork legends, Mockie Ah! crash land at The Everyman this Culture Night with one mission - to make Cork camp again! Join our queens as they pay homage to their camp icons and queer favourites and meet a variety of very special guests from the worlds of burlesque, comedy and live music. With eighteen acts from across Ireland, expect a tour-de-force of sparkling sequins, camp comedy and non-stop nostalgia.

BIO: Recently named one of Ireland's top tourist attractions by BBC One's The Travel Show, Mockie Ah! is Ireland's leading Drag Haus and queer performance collective. The legendary group was founded in 2017 by Irish drag artist Candy Warhol (Comedy Central's Dragony Aunts). The Cork City-based drag family has gone from strength to strength with regular nationwide cabarets, festival shows, club-nights and appearances across Europe. In 2019 the queens were featured on a Virgin Media pride special and in 2021 a critically acclaimed documentary focusing on five members of the group, Kin Of Kweens, was broadcast on RTÉ. In 2022 they hosted shows at Electric Picnic and Body and Soul and in 2023 they embarked on their first nationwide tours with Rupaul's Drag Race stars Le Fil and Just May and enjoyed a sold out run of their now annual Rocky Horror Picture Show. In 2024 they hosted Bambie Thug's Cork homecoming as part of their Cork Pride lineup and their new show, Mockie Ah's Camp Culture will mark the first of several shows at The Everyman.

Keep an eye on social media for updates: https://www.instagram.com/mockieah/
fullAddress: 15 MacCurtain Street, Victorian Quarter, Cork, T23 E094, Ireland

title: Exhibition Talk – Laura Ní Fhlaibhín
description:
The Exhibition Talk will take place in the Gallery with artist Laura Ní Fhlaibhín at 7pm.

As part of Culture Night, Wexford Arts Centre will facilitate a late gallery opening from 5-8pm, offering more time to enjoy the current exhibition of Edge of Range by artist Laura Ní Fhlaibhín. The exhibition focuses on the cotton weed plant and traces the story of its near extinction through a sculptural installation and wall-based works. 

Laura Ní Fhlaibhín is an artist from Wexford. She is a Gilbert Bayes Royal Society of Sculptors Award U.K. recipient 2024 and has been awarded the 2025 Derek Hill Foundation residency at the British School of Rome. She was the recipient of the Goldsmiths Almacantar Bursary 2019, and was awarded the NextGeneration Award 2020 from the Arts Council of Ireland.
fullAddress: Wexford Arts Centre, Cornmarket, Townparks, Wexford, Ireland

title: Exhibition, Tour of the Church of the Holy Spirit, and Iconography Demonstration | We Act
description:
Visit the The Spiritan Heritage & Archives Centre and the Spiritan Promotions Office for an evening of cultural and historic interest. Enjoy a public exhibition, a self-guided tour of the Church, and an iconography demonstration.

Explore the life and work of the Spiritan priests, the Doheny Brothers. The exhibition documents the digitisation of their extensive collection. Marvel at the skills of Ireland's icon painters, showcasing works by the Association of Iconographers Ireland and appreciate this ancient art form. Take a self-guided tour of the Romanesque church with its collegiate nave seating and historical stained-glass windows by Mr. Willie Dowling of Harry Clarke Studios.

This free event is open to all ages.
fullAddress: Kimmage, Dublin, D12 P5YP, Ireland

title: Exhibition: “The Whispering Sea” by Arijit Bhattacharyya, Artlink International Artist in Residence 2024
description:
Arijit Bhattacharyya is an Indian artist who works with installation, textile works, drawing and painting, film, performance and cooking. Most of his works emphasise the collective as well as the experience and the search for interaction and dialogue.

Interpersonal exchange and the process of making are always at the centre of his practice. Through social engagement, design interventions in urban and rural spaces, large murals, lecture performances, and cooking sessions, Arijit explores different narratives of resistance and disobedience, socio-political history and marginalisation, and their impact on our cultural practices.
In interacting with Artlink’s programme, Arijit intends to contribute actively to the local artistic community. Through open studio sessions, workshops, talks, and cooking sessions, he aims to share his artistic journey and insights, fostering dialogues that intertwine the global narrative with the local tapestry.

The Whispering Sea exhibition continues until Friday 27th September.
fullAddress: Artlink, Fort, Dunree, Buncrana, County Donegal, Ireland

genres.title: Visual Arts (Painting, Photography, Sculpture, Digital Art, Print, Etc)

description: Sarah Lewtas, an artist based in Dunlewey, specialises in sculpture and installation. Her exhibition explores well-worn paths that have been forgotten and then rediscovered, evoking unexpected echoes of memory that resonate within the mind's landscape.
