title: St. Patricks Band Rehearsal Night
description:
St. Patricks Band is a Galway based community organisation in existence since 1896. It is run by a committee elected annually by members and it strives to provide:
- a brass band for Galway City and County;
- a musical education for members of the community;
- a premises, ‘the Bandroom’, for use by the band and other community groups.

The band has been teaching music since its foundation and has entertained countless thousands of people over the years, giving public recitals in the summer throughout Galway, taking part in parades, including Galway’s First parade in 1903, civic occasions, charity fundraisers and carols at Christmas, etc. It has been the subject of a number of documentaries on radio and television and has been described as a Galway institution. St. Patrick’s Band was the first group to be heard on the first outside broadcast -Radio 2RN- that came from Galway in 1927.

It is the Band’s ambition and vision to continue the work of keeping brass alive and preserving it into the future and for future generations of players and audience members. The Senior band meets and rehearses every Friday night and on Culture Night we open our doors to the general public so they can see how we are keeping brass alive in Galway.
Come and see our Bandroom, a wonderful centre for music in the heart of Galway. It is also home to a number of publicly funded groups such as choirs, dance organisations and other similar cultural groups which the band supports.

Come and see our Bandroom, a wonderful centre for music in the heart of Galway. It is also home to a number of publicly funded groups such as choirs, dance organisations and other similar cultural groups which the band supports.

Finally we will screen our short film adaption of Pricked. Set during the debs, the film follows a group of friends as they try to work out how one friend was spiked.

title: Stencils Printing Workshop for Adults with Aoife Barrett, Print Van Go
description:
Stencil printing
This D.I.Y. printmaking workshop allows adult participants to learn low-tech printmaking techniques to create simple and colourful prints and patterns on textile and paper. Participants will be introduced to the immediate and flexible form of stencil and block printing and will have the opportunity to learn how to use a variety of printmaking tools to make multi-layered printed artworks inspired by our colourful and abundant natural heritage and native plants. They will be able to choose from a variety of nature-themed stencils and printing blocks to create their own hand-printed designs and images to take home.

Come make, share and print with Print Van Go travelling print studio! Print Van Go is a travelling print studio, championing and sharing participatory printmaking experiences for people of all walks of life. The purpose of Print Van Go is to make art and printmaking more public and accessible to a wider audience by bringing professional printmaking tools, equipment and facilities into the community.

Booking essential by email: midleton.library@corkcoco.ie or by phone 021 4613929

title: Stephen Garland Presents ‘The Best of Us’ – a Show in 3 Parts
description:
Join international comedy promoter and performer Stephen Garland for a unique and captivating live experience in 'The Best Of Us'. This show, spanning three parts, combines comedy, heartfelt storytelling, and a live podcast to deliver an evening of enlightenment, inspiration, and entertainment.

Part 1: The Post Disposed (30 minutes) Witness Stephen's remarkable journey from Brazil to Moscow in this updated, audio-visual comic retelling of his EdFringe show. Battling a "No Treatment No Cure" diagnosis and prognosis, he found hope in an unconventional stem cell therapy. Stephen's story of resilience and humor amidst adversity will leave you both laughing and inspired.

A Show that went to Edinburgh Fringe and subsequently toured through London , Maastricht, Madrid and Barcelona - See 5***** Google Reviews direct from previous audiences here https://www.facebook.com/postdisposed/reviews

Part 2: Canna We Talk Now? Live Podcast (30 minutes) Delve into Stephen's acclaimed YouTube podcast, which amplifies patient voices advocating for cannabis/Hemp rational regulation. There are over 30 clips on the channel that you can whet the appetite with what to expect - https://www.youtube.com/@irishcanna

The Guest will be announced closer to the date.

Part 3. Is simply an A.M.A (Ask Me anything) Town hall style conclusion where you the audience can interact with what you just witnessed in the show.

Booking Recommended

title: Stop Making Sense – Iconic Concert Movie
description:
A screening of the iconic 1984 concert film of Talking Heads' exhilarating live performance.

Newly restored to coincide with its 40th anniversary, the 1984 film was directed by renowned filmmaker Jonathan Demme and is considered by critics as the greatest concert film of all time. The film was shot over three nights at the Pantages Theater in Los Angeles, when the band was promoting their album Speaking in Tongues, which was to give them their smash hit Burning Down the House.

The pairing of director Jonathan Demme and David Byrne proved inspired. Demme’s refusal to show audience reaction until late in the performance creates an immersive experience for the viewer as both the stage set and the band are gradually constructed around Byrne following his shy opening announcement, ‘I’ve got a tape I wanna play’.

1984, 88 minutes, PG

title: Storytelling Session | We Act
description:
Join We Act at Third Space Smithfield for tea, biscuits and shared stories of community, care and culture.

We Act is a campaign to celebrate the doers in our communities. The people who help out, who show initiative, who take a stand. This Culture Night, they'll be telling their own stories, in their own words.

Ireland's charities and community groups are as diverse as the people they serve, from hospice care to homeless services, arts organisations to animal welfare, and disability sports to LGBTQ+ advocacy. We Act Storytelling Session will put a face and a voice to the people who do that work. The staff and volunteers who dedicate their time to helping others and making our communities more vibrant and equitable places to live.

Come along for a compelling evening of diverse stories from those who drive change in our communities.

description:
Enjoy a family-friendly storytelling session in both English and Spanish at the Instituto Cervantes Library in Dublin. The session will include an English reading of ‘The Colour Monster’, a book that helps children understand and manage their emotions, and Spanish readings of ‘El Pequeño Conejo Blanco’ (‘Little White Rabbit’), a classic fable about bravery and friendship, and ‘La Casa de la Mosca Fosca’ a humorous story about coexistence and surprises. In both languages, we will read ‘No hace falta la voz’ and ‘Do not need the voice’, a touching story about how hugs can communicate as much as words. Come along for an afternoon filled with art and stories.

For ages 3 to 9.

title: Strata
description:
Strata is a new exhibition at CCA Derry~Londonderry by artists Marie Farrington, Dorothy Hunter and Amy Stephens. The artworks in the show explore layers of interconnected themes and lines of enquiry exploring geology, extraction, value and thresholds. The three artists use a range of media including photography, sculpture, film and new site-specific installations and interventions.

Exhibition open until 6pm. After hours you can see our live studio used by emerging artists through the windows of our street-facing Project Space and the latest risograph edition in our Window Text series.

Strata - The Artists:

Dorothy Hunter’s work concerns the use of time as a political tool and has a long-term interest in chronopolitics (time and its reading as a political force). She is interested in how we relate to land and geology, with recent work exploring mapped and unseen space in Cuilcagh Lakelands Geopark, the world’s first transnational geopark that has an extensive subterranean cave network. The new body of work developed for Strata includes friezes inspired by the plaster rococo adornment of palladian stately homes, two architectural principles that married in Ireland in ordered, symmetrical re-presentations of natural splendour on interior walls. Using the architectural overhangs of CCA’s Gallery 2 as a stand-in for both the grand house and the caverns of the geopark, drawing from the plaster decoration of Florence Court (home to the 3rd Earl of Enniskillen who invited this land's first documented exploration), Dorothy is referencing inherited dominion and representation of land, and its murky anarchy in underground space.

Amy Stephens’ works are underpinned by geology and travel. She uses photography, collage and everyday materials such as tape to generate new perspectives about time and our appreciation of the landscape. She elevates artefacts through their manipulation, juxtaposing materials and textures. For Amy, she writes, “Rocks and minerals have their own story, but the abundance of any object can be a source of invisibility.”[1] Amy’s work features pristine, often polished stones on pedestals or photographed and presented in constructed frames, urging reflection upon the nature of extraction, time and human creation.

Marie Farrington’s practice reflects on the act of making through geological and archaeological lenses. Using casting, carving, and other sculptural processes, she engages with memory through situated encounters with landscape and architecture. Her work makes formal reference to field sampling, built heritage and histories of display. For Strata, Marie has made a series of interactive carved soapstone forms, which she invites the audience to lift and rearrange. They are accompanied in gallery 3 by new works in anthracite clay. Other new works in cold-bent steel, and slumped and cast glass are concentrated around the thresholds of the exhibition spaces.

title: Studio Visit with Needle Felting Workshop
description:
Award-winning artist Karena Ryan invites you to her Open Studio and Workshop. Visit the artist in her studio, where she will share insights into her artistic journey, her creative process, and the materials she uses. She will discuss why she is passionate about working with Irish-grown wool and repurposing fabrics and the unique qualities they bring to her art.

Discover the art of needle felting using high-quality Irish-grown wool from Galway sheep, Texel, Corriedale, merino, and other breeds. This hands-on workshop will immerse you in the world of wool, where you will learn about the characteristics of a variety of wools, the carding process and needle felting techniques.

Under the artist’s expert guidance, you will create your own needle-felted picture, a personal piece of art to take home. Throughout the workshop, you’ll experience the meditative aspects of needle felting which makes it a highly enjoyable activity.

title: Suantrai Female Vocal Ensemble
description:
Join Suantrai Female Vocal Ensemble for a cultural journey through music & song. Be transported to medieval times, the Norwegian Fjords and the cherry-blossomed gardens of Japan whilst also embracing our own Irish culture both past and present. Sit back and listen to the heavenly voices and rich harmonies of an ensemble of singers that will equally, soothe the soul and awaken your spirit. Founded in 2018 Suantrai is directed by Sara Clancy, one of the original lead singers with Riverdance – The Show, who later went on to perform on the West End & Broadway.

The group consists of approx 25 singers hailing from Gorey and Arklow and the surrounding areas. The choir have performed both national and internationally to great acclaim. In 2019 Suantrai released their debut album “Suantrai”. Recorded at the Jimi Hemp Recording Studio the album has received wondrous reviews and is available on all streaming platforms from iTunes to Spotify.

title: Sweet Dreams: Lullabies Around The World
description:
Sweet Dreams: Lullabies Around The World - 17:30 to 21:30

The Sweet Dreams: Lullabies Around the World project highlights the commonalities of local and migrant populations in Ireland. Participants of the Women’s Programme at Nasc, the Migrant and Refugee Rights Centre, have collected their native lullabies and expressed what the lullabies mean to them through drawing, pictures, crochet, sewing etc. Some participants have recorded themselves singing their chosen lullabies, which you can listen to via the QR codes on the postcards. As part of Culture Night, this small and interactive exhibit wants YOU to participate too! Blank postcards have been provided so that anyone in Cork – of local or migrant background – can draw, write and remember the lullabies you hold most dear. By highlighting the emotions and values that we have in common, we can promote integration and inclusion for everyone in the Cork community.

Galway City Chamber Choir have a selection of music that will bring audiences on a trip around the world with pieces from Ireland, Scotland, Japan, China and more! title: Tailte Eireann Registry of Deeds
description:
Visit Tailte Éireann this Culture Night for an exclusive introduction to the building and the collections, and an insight into their records. The tour will include a visit to the main vault, normally closed to the public, and then proceed upstairs to the Public Room, finishing on the second floor with a demonstration on how to search the unique records in the Genealogical Room.

The Registry of Deeds operates as part of Tailte Éireann, an independent Government agency under the aegis of the Department of Housing, Local Government and Heritage. The Registry of Deeds established by an Act of Parliament in 1707, is one of the oldest continuously functioning state offices in Ireland. The property records held are a valuable source for family, local, social and economic history from 1708 to date.

title: Taiwanese Film Extravaganza: ‘Invisible Nation’ by Vanessa Hope
description:
Join the Taiwan Centre for Mandarin Learning in Ireland at the Savoy Cinema for an unforgettable evening 4 as they present ‘Invisible Nation’ (2023), a documentary exploring Taiwan's transformation from an authoritarian state to a vibrant democracy.

Focusing on President Tsai Ing-wen's efforts to maintain Taiwan's autonomy amid political isolation, ‘Invisible Nation’ is directed and co-produced by Vanessa Hope. This film contrasts Taiwan's democratic achievements with its diplomatic struggles, using interviews and historical footage to highlight Taiwan's journey, the tension with China's territorial claims, and the potential for conflict. Despite these challenges, Taiwan has made significant reforms, like legalising same-sex marriage and promoting human rights. The documentary is timely and thought-provoking, drawing parallels with Ukraine and Hong Kong, and leaving viewers to ponder Taiwan's uncertain future.

title: Talk: ‘Society & State – Ireland Through Its Records’
description:
The National Archives is Ireland’s institution of memory which preserves the State's records. On Culture Night, historian Dr John Gibney will give a public talk in the Reading Room of the National Archives based on ‘Society & State – Ireland Through Its Records’, an exhibition presented by the National Archives which opened to the public in Dublin Castle's Coach House Gallery earlier in the year and runs until 8 September.

The exhibition explores aspects of life in independent Ireland as reflected in records held in the National Archives and covers themes such as sport, popular culture, religion and identities. Dr Gibney will discuss these themes, focusing in particular on Ireland in the 1920s and its evolution in the first decade of its existence.

fullAddress: National Archives of Ireland, Bishop Street, Dublin, Ireland

title: Taster ‘Forge a Silver Ring’ Workshop – Drury Street
description:
Silver Works are opening their doors on Drury Street for Culture Night Dublin 2024 and invite the public to try their hand at some traditional goldsmith techniques.

This event is a walk in, first-come first-serve taster class of their most popular ‘Forge a Silver Ring’ workshop, taking 12 people every half an hour. In this hands-on, immersive experience, you will use copper rings and try your hand with plenty of hammers and mandrels to go around.

Silver Works has hosted jewellery making workshops in the heart of Dublin's creative quarter for 6 years. They continue to grow and develop and have recently opened their second premises, 4 South Great Georges street, Dublin 2.

They are also hosting pre-book only taster sessions in their new premises on George’s Street.

Age 10+

title: Teenage Wasteland Podcast Live with Amy Michelle
description:
A live episode of the Teenage Wasteland Podcast with special guest Amy Michelle will take place in Mullingar's new record store The Vinyl Room this Culture Night at 7.30pm.

In 2022, Amy Michelle released her debut EP, is that all there is? on Method Records, which has now over 4 million Spotify streams and led to support slots with global star Niall Horan at the 3 Arena and Aurora at the National Stadium.

This year sees the opening of a vinyl record store in the projectionist’s room of old cinema building in Mullingar. Owner Daragh Caffrey foresees the space being used by Mullingar’s artistic community for pop-up gigs while also attracting national acts to promote album launches in store.

Teenage Wasteland is a podcast produced by Michael & Johnny Cronin, Live Transmission Records and Will Russell, Hot Press Magazine. On previous episodes, Teenage Wasteland has featured critically acclaimed Americana artist John Murry; former frontman of The Dead Sixties and guitarist with The Specials, Matt McManamon; Anathema, Antimatter and Alternative 4 powerhouse Duncan Patterson; Renaissance Mancunian Paul Gallagher; Republic of Loose dynamo Mik Pyro; punk poet Meryl Streek; legendary mod Irish Jack; Kurt Cobain’s favourite band Shonen Knife and many more.
fullAddress: Wilfs Clothing Store, The Old Cinema, Castle Street, Mullingar, County Westmeath, Ireland

title: Tengu Culture Night: Reggae Yoga with Just Breathe Reeta & Rub A Dub Hifi
description:
This year, Tengu is focusing on Soundsystem Culture as part of the Culture Night Nocturnal Beats trail. They have invited local system Rub A Dub Hifi to the space as well as inviting Just Breathe Reeta for an hour of reggae yoga.

Reggae Yoga is the union of movement and sound. Traditional Yoga Asanas are taught while sweet Reggae Music is being played. This class encourages you to express yourself: sway to the music, allow yourself to be free, and dance your cares away. Speaking of dance, this workshop will also involve some choreographed moves to get you feeling Irie.

Reeta is a 9+ year, 300 hour credited and certified instructor. Reeta primarily teaches Hatha, Restorative, Yin & Vinyasa Yoga. This class will be fun and energetic with a slow flow feel that focuses on deep breathing. After all, Reeta's moniker is ‘Just Breathe’. Reeta Cherie is also a DJ and she's personally picked and mixed the tunes for this class.

Reggae Yoga is suitable for all levels including beginners, so grab your mat, wear your most comfy clothing, free your mind and have have some this Culture Night at Tengu.

An RSVP link for this event will be shared the week of the show. Please note, there are only 20 spots and yoga mats will be supplied at the venue.

title: Tengu Presents: Nocturnal Beats featuring Rub A Dub Hifi + Ambit, Governess, Jonezy, Kelsey & Ciara May + MC/Host TBC
description:
This year, Tengu is focusing on Soundsystem Culture as part of the Culture Night Nocturnal Beats trail. Local system Rub A Dub Hifi as well as inviting an incredible lineup of DJs will be playing all kinds of dub, from reggae, dubstep, jungle, dnb and more. MC Mad X will be hosting the night and bringing her fierce energy to the room!

Over the years Rub A Dub Hi-Fi have brought their sound to festivals across the country. Curating and powering many stages at different festivals and events. After launching their new bass music night in 2018 called Subconscious they held events hosting Parly B, Jacky Murda, Mr. Williamz, Brother Culture and to finish the year they brought Deep Medi don Mala for a night no one will forget. In November 2019 they hosted Channel One Soundsystem who have pioneered soundsystem culture for 40+ years.

MC and Sing-Jay Artist Mad-X from South London, has been performing at festivals, private parties, dances, stage shows and clubs for over 20 years, both nationally and internationally. Mad-X's raw and unapologetic style was cultivated from an early age in the shebeems and dancehalls of 90s South London.

As an MC, Mad-X style is a great accompaniment to most music genres but is undoubtedly heavily influenced from her early days in reggae, dub and 80s/90s dancehall. Merged with current styles of MC’ing Mad-X goal is to perform on the biggest stages of the world. To date such stages include; Notting Hill Carnival, Leicester Carnival, Scala nightclub, Hootananny Brixton, and other clubs, festivals and dancehalls throughout the UK and Europe.

Yamamori Tengu opened its doors to dancers in 2013. Adorned with genuine Japanese artefacts, the club is overlooked by the legendary creature ‘tengu’, a mischievous supernatural being. Warm lights, friendly faces and a bar stocked with both local and Japanese beverages create a unique atmosphere. Tengu’s dance floor has been an integral part of Irish nightlife for almost a decade for the ravers, music lovers and everyone in between.

title: Terra Fabula
description:
Terra Fabula is a series of eight paintings, along with supporting materials (photographs, sketches, reports), which explores a complex and fractured narrative. The collection explores the conflict between the ancient, natural world and our modern, industry heavy society.

As an exhibition, I envision it as an immersive experience, with the various elements portraying a cruel indifference towards life, and is an attempt to depict the often incomprehensibly horrific consequences of those actions. Terra Fabula is a conceptual, narrative collection. Each painting acts as a chapter in the narrative with an accompanying, albeit censored report detailing the experiment and its results. Each chapter also includes photographs and sketches which fill out the narrative. As the experiments continue, the organism reacts in increasingly strange and hostile ways, becoming more and more degraded and toxic.

In each chapter the painting becomes more and more corrupted and polluted. This is represented through changes in colour and texture, as can be seen in the accompanying sketches as well as my previous work. Each painting will be a combination of acrylic paint, resin, mixed media items, and multiple canvases layered with the aim of creating an ethereal, otherworldly presence.

title: Terry Pratchett at the Unseen University
description:
This Culture Night, the Pratchett Project is excited to present a special talk series on the life and work of Terry Pratchett.

This event will bring together a wide range of speakers, each discussing their unique area of research, all relating in different and interesting ways to the legendary writer.

The Pratchett Project in Trinity College Dublin is an interdisciplinary platform for research into the life and works of Terry Pratchett. It builds on the comprehensive collection of Pratchett’s works and their translations into forty languages, held in the Trinity College Library, as well as Pratchett’s personal connection with the College, borne out of the adjunct professorship he held from 2010.

title: The Ancient Voice of Peace
description:
The Ancient Voice of Peace shared by Interdisciplinary performing artist Avia Gurman Murphy and Sacred song artist Eileen Bray is a sacred song ritual for peace that will incorporate Celtic Kirtan created by Eileen and Jewish and other sacred music repertoire delivered by Avia.

Through ancient languages and traditions of song spanning Gaelic, Indian, Jewish, and Christian music traditions, Eileen and Avia are aiming to build a heartfelt bridge of peace that will echo near and far and will attempt to bring healing in these difficult times of unrest and war.

Through music and poetry read and sung by Eileen and Avia, emotions of joy, gratitude, and grief will be shared, and the community will come together in East Clare to witness and share hearts and pray for peace.

title: The Art of Miró
description:
The Instituto Cervantes Dublin presents a vibrant programme open to all audiences and ages to enjoy Spanish culture in Ireland.

The library of the Instituto Cervantes offers you this art & crafts workshop for the whole family. Led by Raquel Hernanz, a Spanish teacher with over a decade of experience working with children and a passion for crafts, the little ones will be able to discover the fascinating world of Spanish artist Joan Miró, whose work is renowned for its rich colours and the creation of shapes that seem to come to life.

The workshop will focus on his mosaics and sculptures through two activities:
For ages 3 to 6 (accompanied by an adult): Little Artists in Action
For ages 7 to 10: Exploring Colour and Shape

title: The Art of Singing – Choral Performance by Voices of Bray Community Choir
description: Enjoy a performance from the talented Voices of Bray Community Choir on Culture Night at the National Gallery of Ireland. Voices of Bray is a 120-voice non-auditioned choir, founded in 2013. The choir performs several concert events each year and has competed in festivals both in Ireland and overseas. Singing for the enjoyment of its members and the wider community, the choir's performances have also raised in excess of €95,000 for Irish charities and causes. The Culture Night performance will feature songs from the likes of Elton John, Coldplay, Billy Joel, Adele, Simon & Garfunkel and medleys from Phantom of the Opera and My Fair Lady. title: The Arts Council on Culture Night
description:

In addition, the Arts Council will once again proudly showcase a selection of works recently added to its extensive Visual Art Collection.

The Arts Council Collection was established in 1962 and now comprises almost 1,350 works of modern and contemporary Irish art. This year we are delighted to once again welcome audiences to the Arts Council buildings on Merrion Square, Dublin to engage with some our most recent acquisitions.

Works by many of Ireland’s leading artists will be shown on the night including pieces by: Elizabeth Cope, Miriam De Búrca, Mollie Douthit, Justin Fitzpatrick, Marie Holohan, Helen Hughes, Catriona Leahy, Jialin Long, Kevin Mooney, Emma Roche, Mark Swords and Amna Walayat.

title: The Bahaghs Workhouse Incident
description:
A storytelling theatre performance, exploring the notorious incident, occurring in 1923, during the Irish Civil War, when five IRA prisoners, held at the Bahaghs workhouse near Cahersiveen, were taken out one night and blown up with a landmine. Subsequent cover-ups have meant that the true circumstances have never been fully revealed.

The evening also includes local musicians, The Music Makers, performing well-known tunes of many genres played in the classical style on flute, clarinet and cello.

title: The Big Ukulele Bus Busk
description:
On Culture Night, the Big Ukulele Bus Busk will hit the streets! Our aim is to spread some joy and bring some music to people who may not be able to go out on the night.

The bus will depart at 6.30 from McAuley Place and travel to some venues around Kildare before returning to play for the residents in McAuley Place at 9pm where a sing-along audience will be very much encouraged!

We are looking for ukulele players to fill the bus! In advance of Culture Night, a bus busk book will be issued with standard beginner/intermediate ukulele songs which will be used on the night. All levels of players are welcome - even if you are just learning to strum your first C chord.

To book your seat on the bus, please email Sheena Malone at sheenamalone@hotmail.com or call 086 3775318. Due to limited capacity, advance booking for the bus is essential.

As some of the venues are health care settings, they will not be open to the general public on the night. The singalong concert in McAuley place will be open to all, however tickets will need to be booked in advance.

Refreshments will be served after the event in McAuley Place.

If you are a ukulele player and would like a seat for the bus email sheenamalone@hotmail.com
If you would like to attend the sing-along concert in McAuley Place, please follow the link: https://www.eventbrite.ie/e/1014346857757?aff=oddtdtcreator

title: The Blue Star
description:
"Do you have a caring disposition or are you in need of caring? The Blue Star is the answer! Meet the savvy Martina, the charming Phildelma and the wallflower Ciara at the Town Hall Theatre Bar on the 20th of September at 6pm and hear how their input made the Galway Branch of The Blue Star the award-winning care agency we know and love today. The Blue Star is a comic yet moving play that asks some tough questions about the Irish homecare system and how we perceive caring.

Playwright Aoibheann McCann says “Caring is an issue that affects more and more of my friends as I get older.” We each have our personal challenging obstacles to deal with in caring for each other and ourselves and we constantly question whether this is even possible. It is this weighty life question that this play embraces and which makes these three women such fascinating characters to meet.

Excerpts of The Blue Star will be performed by stalwarts of the Irish Theatre community: Tara Breathnach (Martina), Sorcha Fox (Phildelma) and Brídín Nic Dhonncha (Ciara). Directed and dramaturged by Mairéad Folan (NoRopes Theatre Company). This event is in partnership with Town Hall Theatre, Galway. A Q&A with the creative team, chaired by Fergal McGrath (Venue Director, Town Hall Theatre) will follow the performance.

Tickets available from Town Hall Theatre www.tht.ie from Fri 6 Sept, 10am

Location: Upstairs in Town Hall Theatre, Galway 1 Courthouse Square, Galway, H91 H3C2
*this event is wheelchair accessible

It aims to intertwine research of neuroplasticity, community-based arts for wellbeing and the use of the Arts for interpreting and expressing individual narratives of disability. This aligns with the core values of the Trinity DisAbility Service which aims to create an accessible, transformational, educational environment.

title: The Esther Project Launch – New Celbridge Artist Collective
description:
The Esther Project, named after Esther Vanhomrigh of Celbridge Abbey, are a new women-led arts collective committed to fostering community and creating inclusive spaces through arts. Their mission is to provide opportunities for artistic expression and connection in their town. For Culture Night, they invite you to join in honouring Esther’s legacy with an evening full of creative activities. title: The Galway Céilí Club: Pop-Up Céili
description:
Galway Céilí Club is committed to making traditional Irish dance fun and accessible to the people of Galway. For Culture Night, we are transforming multiple locations across Galway City Centre into a lively stage with our mobile céilí unit.

Our troupe of three talented musicians, mobile sound system and eight skilled dancers will host up to seven pop-up céilís, bringing spontaneous bursts of music and dance to unexpected spots across Galway City Centre between 6pm & 9pm. At each stop, the dance master will invite the audience to join in and learn a few steps, making every performance an interactive and inclusive experience. This dynamic event aims to surprise and delight passersby, creating a festive atmosphere that celebrates our rich cultural heritage. Perfect for all ages and skill levels, our pop-up céilí will foster community spirit and introduce the joy of Irish dance to both locals and visitors alike. So grab your dancing shoes and strike the cobblestones with us as we chain, swing and house across three hours of foot stomping fun this Culture Night.

title: The Gaze – Projection / Shortcut to the Soul – Visual Art Installation by Todor Gerov
description:
Drop by the Embassy of the Republic of Bulgaria on Culture Night for the rare opportunity to witness the installation ‘Gaze - Projection’, by the visual artist Todor Gerov, who engages in a modern way of projecting female images from Bulgarian and Irish classical art, provoking the spectator to read women's emotions through their eyes and reflect upon the evolving positions and role of women in society.

This event is part of the European Culture Trail – a EUNIC Ireland (European Union National Institutes for Culture) initiative in cooperation with the European Commission Representation in Ireland. Immerse yourself in the diversity of European languages and cultures on the European Culture Trail, where delights from different European countries await you.

For those visiting European Culture Trail events in person, you are invited to download the “European Culture Trail Treasure Hunt” passport here https://rb.gy/4cbske and collect stamps or signatures at each stop. The passports with the most stamps at the end of the night will be entered into a raffle for the chance to win wonderful prizes.
host: Embassy of the Republic of Bulgaria
fullAddress: 22 Burlington Rd, Dublin 4, Dublin, D04 N9C1, Ireland

genres.title: Visual Arts (Painting, Photography, Sculpture, Digital Art, Print, Etc)

title: The Ghost of Kathleen Lynn, Music Video Launch and Trad Session
description: Kathleen Lynn was a veteran of the 1916 Rising and a pioneering children's doctor. Discover more about the life and work of this extraordinary woman by visiting her holiday cottage (now an An Óige youth hostel), followed by the launch of a new music video "The Ghost of Kathleen Lynn" (song by Marion McEvoy, video shot and directed by filmmaker Hannah Bloom in and around Glenmalure Hostel) at the Glenmalure Lodge Hotel. Dr Lynn is held in great affection by the people of the Glen, some of whom will be present on the night to share their stories. We also hope to have a few tunes from local and visiting musicians.
fullAddress: The Glenmalure Lodge, Wicklow Way, Ballyboy, Glenmalure, Wicklow, Ireland

title: The Gift
description: An evening with Mary's Meals charity celebrating through an exhibition, art and music.
fullAddress: Abbeycartron, Longford, N39 EA43, Ireland

title: The Gravedigger Ghost Bus Tour
description:
The Gravedigger Ghost Bus Tour invites brave souls to experience a spine-chilling journey through Dublin's dark history on Culture Night.

This immersive tour blends historical tales, eerie folklore, and theatrical performances to bring the city's haunted past to life. Participants will board a uniquely designed bus that transforms into a moving theatre, complete with actors who recount gruesome stories of Dublin’s most notorious characters. The tour includes stops at some of the city's most infamous sites, offering a unique perspective on Dublin's macabre history.

Ideal for thrill-seekers and history buffs alike, this event promises an unforgettable evening of storytelling, scares, and sinister secrets.

This tour begins from The Gravedigger Ghost Bus Tour, bus stop at 24 College Green, D02 E198.

locations.title: Dublin City - Temple Bar And Creative Quarter

fullAddress: The Gravedigger Bus Tour, Church Lane, Dublin, Ireland

title: The Importance of Being Earnest by Oscar Wilde
description:
'The Importance of Being Earnest, a Trivial Comedy for Serious People’ by Oscar Wilde was first performed in 1895 and has been popular since. Two well-to-do, idle, young gentlemen deceive their families to avoid tiresome social obligations. In the course of their deception, they realise the vital importance of being ‘Ernest’ in matters of the heart.

Eleven young actors from Straffan Drama Club will perform in the beautiful setting of the Orchard Garden Centre and Café in full period costume, directed by Geraldine O’Brien.

Booking through Eventbrite.

Straffan Drama Club is affiliated to Foróige and based in Straffan Community Hall.
fullAddress: Orchard Garden Centre, Dublin Road, Donaghcumper, Celbridge, County Kildare, Ireland

title: The Inaugural Edition of Finglas Film Festival at St. Canice’s Church
description:
Come along to the inaugural Finglas Film Festival on Culture Night, and grab the chance to see films from local film-makers at this special screening followed by a Q&A session with the filmmakers.

Culture Night is a great opportunity to put a spotlight on some of the many talented film-makers, actors, directors and producers in Finglas. After running online events during lockdown, Finglas Film Festival are now very excited to run an in-person event in real time.
fullAddress: St Canice's Church of Ireland, Church Street, Finglas, Dublin, Ireland

genres.title: Visual Arts (Painting, Photography, Sculpture, Digital Art, Print, Etc)

title: The Irish Arts Show Presents Singer-Songwriter Fin Furey
description: The Irish Arts Show presents the unique music and an inspiring story of Dublin-based singer-songwriter Fin Furey. In his music Fin explores a wide range of themes ranging from protest and liberation, to comical revelations about life and how each of us choose to live it. His music has been described as storytelling with a pulse. Fin’s live performance "The Irish Arts Show Presents Singer-Songwriter Fin Fureyormances" blurs the lines between a concert and a late bar lock-in sing-along session. The Irish Arts Show was launched in April 2021 as a collaboration between Irish trad musician Stephen Leeson and the volunteers of the Scientology Community Centre to support artists and bring entertainment and joy. Since then, the show has expanded to welcome accomplished singer Angel as host and has welcomed over 500 artists, plus hosted numerous fundraisers for different charitable causes.
fullAddress: Firhouse Road, Firhouse, Dublin, Dublin D24CX39

title: The Irish Madonna in Hungary: Exhibition with Traditional Hungarian Music
description:
The Hungarian Embassy in Dublin warmly welcomes all visitors to a captivating exhibition centred on the Weeping Virgin Mother of Győr - the Irish Madonna.
Experience the unique historical connection between the Lynch family and Galway, and how the devotional painting found a new home in the Hungarian city of Győr around 1655.

Immerse yourself in the timeless beauty of the Irish Madonna, soundtracked by come traditional Hungarian music. A short film will also be screened, to enhance understanding and appreciation of the religious links of the image and the cultural exchange between Ireland and Hungary. Don't miss this opportunity to witness a blend of art, history and music in a truly enchanting setting.

This event is part of the European Culture Trail – a EUNIC Ireland (European Union National Institutes for Culture) initiative in cooperation with the European Commission Representation in Ireland. Immerse yourself in the diversity of European languages and cultures on the European Culture Trail, where delights from different European countries await you.

For those visiting European Culture Trail events in person, you are invited to download the “European Culture Trail Treasure Hunt” passport here - https://rb.gy/4cbske - and collect stamps or signatures at each stop. The passports with the most stamps at the end of the night will be entered into a raffle for the chance to win some wonderful prizes.
fullAddress: Embassy of Hungary, Fitzwilliam Place, Dublin 2, D02 K227, Ireland

title: The Jazz Trio – Improvised music with Polish Folklore
description: The Jazz Trio – especially created for Culture Night 2024 Cavan, three Polish musicians from Pstryk will play jazz standards and some polish jazz music.
fullAddress: Cavan Town Hall, Town Hall Street, Keadew, Cavan, Ireland

title: The Kabin Studio – Music jams, Workshops & Seisúin ceol
description:
Music jams, Workshops & Seisúin ceol

Rap, Beats, Songwriting & Recording Workshop - 6 to 11 year olds - 16:00 to 17:00
Rap, Beats, Songwriting & Recording Workshop - 11 to 16 year olds - 17:00 to 18:00

Open Trad Session & Jam - age 14+ (under 16s must be accompanied by an adult). Presented by Creative Tradition and Musical Neighbourhoods. 18:15 to 20:00

Open Mic & Showcase featuring performances by Kabin Crew, Misneach & more - 16+ (under 16s must be accompanied by an adult) Presented by The Kabin Studio in partnership with Music Generation Cork City . 20:30 to 22:00
fullAddress: Harbour View Road, Cork, Ireland

title: The King Connection and Boyle Abbey
description: The Office of Public Works is delighted to offer a complimentary guided tour focusing on King family connections with Boyle Abbey during the 1600 and 1700s. The tour will examine alterations made to the architecture of the Abbey, the evolving political situation, the King’s eventual transition to King House in 1720, and the condition of the Abbey during the latter part of the 1700s.
fullAddress: Boyle Abbey, Knocknashee, Boyle, County Roscommon, Ireland

title: The Language of Colour & Launch of Two New Portraits in Roscommon Rising
description:
Artist Siobhan Cox is giving a talk and presentation on a subject close to her heart- colour. In this 40 minute talk she will give an overview of how colour works and will show examples of this with paintings from some of her favourite painters around the world. This talk is suitable for all, whether you have no knowledge of colour or are studying painting and/or are interested in learning about a topic which will help you to make your experience as a viewer more informed and enjoyable. It should give you an insight on how to ‘read’ a painting and what colour systems an artist was using whilst creating a piece.

Siobhan will have a deletion of her own paintings on view and will also reveal her latest two portraits in her series ‘Roscommon Rising’. Last year she started the series with portraits of Douglas Hyde, Margaret (Gretta) Cousins and Chris O’Dowd.
fullAddress: Úna Bhán Tourism, Knocknashee, Boyle, County Roscommon, Ireland

genres.title: Visual Arts (Painting, Photography, Sculpture, Digital Art, Print, Etc)

title: The Launch of Ballyconnell Market House!
description:
On Culture Night we want to invite the community along to see our new building and learn about its past and what the future may hold for our arts, culture and heritage hub.
The programme will start with an exploration night with a talk from Tony Connolly on the history of the Market House and Market House Square.
Come alone and celebrate the first exhibition of local artwork, live music, food and much more!

Exhibition opens from 12:00pm
fullAddress: Market Square, Doon, Ballyconnell, County Cavan, Ireland

title: The Light From Here
description:
The window exhibition by artist Catherine Fanning - ‘The Light From Here’ is inspired by prints that are being created for the ‘a kind word project’. The project is about the making of original mixed media prints that is inspired by plants. Studies show that all plants provide mental health benefits. Constantly seeing and being around plants help us feel more calm and relaxed, thus decreasing levels of anxiety.

On world mental health day Oct 10th Catherine will leave original artwork in three locations around Boyle. You are invited to take an artwork for FREE, in exchange you are asked to share with a stranger a kind word and a smile.

‘A kind word’ project, exploring my artists practice under the heading of Mental Health is supported by the Roscommon County Council Creative Ireland Programme, an all-of-Government five-year initiative, which places creativity at the centre of public policy. Further information from creative.ireland.ie and ireland.ie. Follow artist Catherine Fanning on Instagram (catherinefanningvisualartist) to find out the locations on Oct 10th that you can get a FREE artwork.
fullAddress: Bridge Street, Termon, Boyle, County Roscommon, Ireland

genres.title: Visual Arts (Painting, Photography, Sculpture, Digital Art, Print, Etc)

title: The Literary Year in Galway
description: Charlie Byrne's Bookshop will host their annual review of the literary year in Galway once again this Culture Night when it invites anyone who has written a book or contributed to an anthology in the last year to read from it for 5 minutes. This template includes poetry, fiction, non-fiction and academic writing and gives a great overview of the writing culture of Galway City and County in the 12 months since Culture Night 2023.The variety of voices and subject-matter invariably provide a fascinating mosaic of the rich world of the written word in Galway.
fullAddress: Charlie Byrne's Bookshop, Middle Street, Galway, Ireland

title: The Little Museum’s Famous Guided Tour
description:
Join one of The Little Museum's famous guided tours at their delightful pop-up venue at 33 Lower Pembroke Street. The museum is home to a treasury of artefacts, all donated by the people of Dublin. The story of Dublin is brought to life by one of the museum's notoriously charming guides in a fast paced, hilarious guided tour.

This is a museum that gets to the heart of the history, hospitality and humour of Dublin and its people. Each performance lasts approximately 25 minutes.
fullAddress: 33 Pembroke Street Lower, Dublin 2, Ireland

title: The Living Tradition
description:
The Irish Traditional Music Archive will open its doors to the public on Culture Night, inviting visitors to enjoy a series of six concerts of traditional Irish music, song and dance performed by a selection of the country's leading traditional artists.

Performances will be half an hour in length. Audiences for each performance will be limited to 50 so advanced booking is a must.

All age groups are welcome. Concerts will be staged in the ITMA library on the first floor, which is only accessible by a flight of stairs.
host: Irish Traditional Music Archive / Taisce Cheol Dúchais Éireann
fullAddress: Irish Traditional Music Archive, Merrion Square South, Dublin 2, Ireland

title: The Loft Gig Night
description:
Experience the joy of live performances as The Loft proudly presents an electrifying Gig Night on Culture Night. Don’t miss an unforgettable evening where the spotlight shines on young and talented musicians, as they take to the stage to play live and entertain audiences.

The Loft's Gig Night is all about providing a dynamic platform for young artists to showcase their talents. Some of the best young talent will be performing on the night. Prepare to be amazed by the raw energy and fresh sounds that these young musicians bring to the stage.
Visit The Loft on Culture Night and support the rise of the next generation of Donegal’s musical legends. Confirmed acts for the evening include Stainless Steel, Ella Fitzgerald and The Veridian.
fullAddress: Donegal Youth Service, Port Road, Letterkenny, County Donegal, Ireland

title: The Magic of Felt Making at Tipperary Town Library
description:
Join textile artist, Joanne Ryan, to try your hand at making felt from unspun wool. Felt-making is an ancient craft of making fabric by locking together fibres (generally wool) using friction and moisture. This is the traditional 'wet' felting technique, kids will also get the opportunity to try a little needle felting to create a design on their piece.

**CROWD PHOTOGRAPHY / DIGITAL RECORDING RELEASE NOTICE**
Please be aware that by entering this area, your photograph and/or digital recording will be used, without compensation, for the use in all media and you release Tipperary County Council and The Arts Council from liability whatsoever of any nature.
If you have any questions about data protection please contact: artsoffice@tipperarycoco.ie
fullAddress: Carrownreddy, Tipperary, E34 KP60, Ireland

title: The Making of ‘In ár gcroithe go deo’, 2020 Legacy Cross installation
description:
The Making of 'In ár gcroithe go deo' (In our hearts forever) is a film documenting the 2020 special legacy collaborative arts installation project by the Tudor Artisan Hub. This project honoured 22 loved ones from or connected to Carrick-on-Suir who passed away in 2020, under very difficult conditions, during the Covid-19 pandemic lockdown.

This is the story about how a community of 45 visual artists and writers came together offering comfort to the bereaved families who experienced such a tremendous loss under unprecedented circumstances. The 2020 creative project disrupted the helplessness we had all felt as the callous nature of the Covid regulations, necessary as they were, affected those in the most vulnerable of circumstances in our community. As creatives, we could do something beautiful, we could offer the arts as a means of transcendence, celebration and renewal.

‘In ár gcroíthe go Deo’ Legacy Project has clearly demonstrated the transformative and healing power of the creative arts.

**CROWD PHOTOGRAPHY / DIGITAL RECORDING RELEASE NOTICE**
Please be aware that by entering this area, your photograph and/or digital recording will be used, without compensation, for the use in all media and you release Tipperary County Council and The Arts Council from liability whatsoever of any nature.
If you have any questions about data protection please contact: artsoffice@tipperarycoco.ie
fullAddress: Townparks, Carrick-on-Suir, County Tipperary, E32 CX59, Ireland

genres.title: Visual Arts (Painting, Photography, Sculpture, Digital Art, Print, Etc)

title: The Mansion House Self Guided Tour
description:
This Culture Night, visitors to The Mansion House are invited to talk a walk through the public rooms of the Lord Mayor's official residence, built by Joshua Dawson and the scene of important civic and historic events for over 300 years. Come along to have an exclusive look inside the Oak Room, Drawing Room, Dining Room, and Lady Mayoress Parlour.

The Oak Room was built as a condition of the purchase agreement with Joshua Dawson. It is, as the name suggests, panelled entirely of oak, with some of the original panelling still in place. Designed over 300 years ago for civic receptions, it is still used for this purpose today. The room contains a number of fine portraits including that of Charles Stewart Parnell, founder of the Home Rule Party. Also on show here are individual coat-of-arms of Dublin’s Lord Mayors. Each Lord Mayor meets with the Chief Herald of Ireland, who is based in the National Library, to agree on a Coat of Arms reflecting their life.

Staff will be on hand to assist visitors on their self-guided tour.
fullAddress: Dublin, D02 AF30, Ireland

title: The Nás Na Rí Singers
description:
The Nás Na Rí Singers is a four-part community choir with over 70 members based in Naas, Co. Kildare. The choir meets weekly on Thursday nights in Naas and performs in at least two concerts per year. The choir has a broad musical repertoire, ranging from choral works and sacred music to more contemporary songs arranged for choral singing, as well as pieces from a variety of musical genres and from many parts of the world, often resulting in singing in different languages.
There are many physical and mental health benefits associated with singing in a choir, including improvements to breathing and posture, the heart and immune system, blood pressure, not to mention overall happiness! We invite you to come along to watch us perform, meet the members, and find out more about joining the choir.
fullAddress: St. David's Church Naas, South Main Street, Naas East, Naas, County Kildare, Ireland

title: The National Print Museum Comes To Life: An Evening of Workshops and Demonstrations
description:
The National Print Museum celebrates the story of printing in Ireland and its impact on our lives. PrintLab, a project launched by the Museum in 2019, facilitates discovery of the traditional craft of letterpress printing through new technologies.

Get creative on Culture Night and drop in for some PrintLab workshops, design your own prints to take home, and see the Museum's collection of letterpress equipment in action, as retired printers and compositors demonstrate some of the machines.

Hour-long workshops are first-come, first-served and run at 16:00, 17:30 and 19:00.

This event takes place on the ground floor of the Museum, which is wheelchair accessible from the cafe entrance.
fullAddress: National Print Museum, Haddington Road, Dublin, D04 E0C9, Ireland

genres.title: Visual Arts (Painting, Photography, Sculpture, Digital Art, Print, Etc)

title: The Nature of Ukraine
description:
A exhibition on the theme of Nature by Ukrainian artist Osnach Oksana Vasiliivna will be hosted in Terryland Forest Park by the Tuatha volunteer group as part of Culture Night.

Ukraine is endowed with the wonders of nature including mountains, forests, sea coasts, rivers, lakes, valleys and vast grasslands known as the steppes much of which are covered with the sunflower, the country’s natonal symbol.

Oksana’s vibrant paintings pulsates with the symbiotic relationship that traditionally existed in Ukraine between its people and its natural landscapes. This is a story that we need to be reminded of at the time when both its human population and its natural environment have been devasted by the Russian invasion.

Oksana has won many accolades for her art works which have featured in multiple exhibitons across Ukraine and her paintings have been bought by collectors worldwide. A former professor of Art at Kherson State University, she now lives in Kiev.

The Nature of Ukraine exhibition will take place from 6pm to 8pm on Culture Night at ‘An Nead’ beside the Sandy Road entrance to Terryland Forest Park. Google map: https://maps.app.goo.gl/toQCaeDmsRoNXZgP8

Visitors travelling by car can avail of the nearby free public Sandy Road carpark.
fullAddress: Terryland Park, Dyke Road, Galway, Ireland

title: The NCF Culture Coop Presents Ethio Groove Selecter
description:
Hewan Mulugeta, aka Ethio Grooves, is a Dublin based Ethiopian Dj who is making a scene in different Irish festivals and music venues. She is vinyl collector with special interest in Ethiopian modern and trad music from 60s/70s and all African grooves from the same era. Her selections covers, afro-funk, afrobeat, highlife, rare finds of all gener of music from Africa.

Beside her monthly radio show on Dublin digital radio Hewan has bee part of Donal Dineen’s backstory guest djs and played on ATN, Body & Soul , Cork Jazz festivals and different venues in Dublin and across the counties. Also supported and played with local and international djs and artists like Hailu Mergia and Def Nettle.
fullAddress: Ballina Arts Centre, Barrett Street, Mullauns, Ballina, County Mayo, Ireland

title: The Night Garden
description:
Artists Kevin and Stephanie Hanlon are creating a site specific installation inspired by characters from Lewis Carroll's Alice in Wonderland. The installation will be developed using sustainable materials and recycled objects.

The installation is located in the service lane to theright of Spirit Clothing Shop, Main street, Longford.

This event was funded though the Culture Night Late / Night Time Economy Initiative of The Department of Tourism, Culture, Arts, Gaeltacht, Sport and Media.
fullAddress: Townparks, Longford, N39 E8D2, Ireland

genres.title: Visual Arts (Painting, Photography, Sculpture, Digital Art, Print, Etc)

title: The O’Connors (O’Conors) of Connacht
description: In Sligo Abbey at 6.30pm on Culture Night, Dr Kieran O’Conor, School of Geography, Archaeology and Irish Studies, University of Galway, will deliver a lecture entutled The O’Connors (O’Conors) of Connacht. This lecture will examine the history and archaeology of the the various branches of the O’Connors of Connacht – namely, the O’Conor Don, O’Conor Roe and O’Conor Sligo septs. Various other O’Connor clans historically located in other provinces of Ireland are not related to the O’Connors of Connacht, being descended from different people. It's a lecture that coincides with this year's 400th anniversary of the installation of the O Connor Monument in the Abbey.
fullAddress: Sligo Abbey, Abbey Street, Abbeyquarter North, Sligo, Ireland

title: The Offaly Down Syndrome Christmas Single Video Launch
description: Offaly Down Syndrome Association have teamed up with Simon Casey to release their own version of John Lennon's “Happy Xmas (War Is Over)” for the upcoming festive season. On Culture Night, they will be presenting their amazing music video to the public for the first time.
fullAddress: Tullamore, County Offaly, R35 NY50, Ireland

title: The Only Ones
description:
Local teenage duo Denis Morrissey and Ed Morrissey perform together as The Only Ones. Denis is on vocals and plays bass guitar and Ed plays lead guitar. They have a 30-minute set of their own original rock songs.

They have had great publicity and recognition over the last two years through performances in their schools, on The Declan Meehan Show on East Coast FM, and in 2023 they appeared on The Late Late Toy Show. With their original sound, these guys are not to be missed!
fullAddress: Wicklow Library, The Mall, Corporation Lands, Wicklow, Ireland

title: The Opacas Birthday Party!
description: The Opacas (www.Opacas.com) released their debut album last year after 4 years or releasing singles. Their videos on YouTube demonstrate the band collaborating with other local artistic groups like Knocknacarra Amateur Theatre Society, Athenry Drama Group, Moycullen Musical Society and many others. The band have recently collaborated with local female vocal group, KaRoSal and will be releasing a single with them in the autumn (You Know Me) which has featured on Galway Bay FM. The band are also preparing for a recording session in the famous Abbey Road recording studios in London later this year. Come see the band perform live and join them as they celebrate the 4 year anniversary of the launch of their debut single 'Out Of My Mind' in the venue where the video was filmed!
fullAddress: The Office, Bóthar Na Trá Uachtarach, Galway, Ireland

title: The Paper: Art Writing Workshop
description:
The aim of this workshop is to explore the role of writing in art practice. The workshop is open to all interested participants, regardless of experience. We will be engaging with ideas around art writing, ekphrasis, alternative forms of criticism, collage and language as a found object.

Key readings will be discussed that explore the contemporary relationship between writing and visual art-making. The workshop will include a number of writing exercises and participants are invited to share their finished work on our website.
fullAddress: spacecraft Artist Studios, Irishtown, Limerick, Ireland

genres.title: Visual Arts (Painting, Photography, Sculpture, Digital Art, Print, Etc)

title: The Parasol All Star Jazz Dance Class
description:
Join The Parasol All Star Jazz Band and a professional swing dance instructor for an exciting evening of beginner swing dance class. Where you will get to:
• Learn some basic swing dance steps from a professional instructor.
• Dance to live music provided by the fantastic Parasol All Star Jazz Band.
• Enjoy an evening of great music, friends, and dance.
venueName: The Metric Bar at the Imperial
fullAddress: The Imperial Bar & Nightclub, Main Street, Townparks, Cavan, Ireland

title: The Patriot’s Walk: Living History Walking Tour
description:
Launching on Culture Night for the very first time, this walking tour from Dublin Castle to Kilmainham Jail celebrates the people and places associated with Ireland's revolutionary movement and the 1916 Rebellion. The route takes in Dublin Castle, Cornmarket, Thomas Street, James Street, Bow Lane West and Kilmainham Lane, and finishes in The Patriots Inn pub with a slide show, music and refreshments.

Beyond Culture Night, the tour will be available to the general public as a collaboration between Daltons Musical History Tour and The Patriots Inn.

Start point: Side entrance of City Hall.

locations.title: Dublin City - Liberties And Historic Quarter

fullAddress: 2 Dame St, Dublin, Ireland

title: The Pay Attention! Collective Presents: Snoopy Dog Actual Dog and Friends
description:
An evening of story-telling, song, poetry, and bum-sniffing with Ireland's favourite dog - who doesn't happen to be owned by the president - the rambunctious, the unstoppable, the legendary, the one and only true and original Snoopy Dog Actual Dog (TM), presented by and with contributions from members of the Pay Attention! Collective.

Snoopy Dog Actual Dog is a very good 305-year-old Labradoodle - that’s 43.5 in human years. He likes long walks, various kinds of meat, shouting at delivery drivers and writing (and occasionally performing) works of short fiction. For Culture Night Dublin 2024, he will be telling a few stories from his soon-to-be published collection, entitled 'Asses I have sniffed and tears I have licked.' Snoopy Dog Actual Dog is a member of the Pay Attention! Collective of artists, members of whom he will be supported by on this wonderful night.

The Pay Attention! Collective meet every week in Ryan's of Store Street to share cool stories, poems and art, complaining about mediocre television and film and occasionally solving crimes and/or ghost-hunting.
fullAddress: MART HX Village Studios, Greenmount Lane, Harold's Cross, Dublin, Ireland

title: The Peace Heroines of Northern Ireland
description: This travelling exhibition curated by HerStory, celebrates the role of women from grassroots up to government levels in the building of peace in Northern Ireland across borders, political and religious divides. The exhibition features 30 women’s stories, including Bridget Bond, Monica Patterson, Ruth Agnew, Bernadette Devlin-McAliskey, Inez McCormack and Dr. Mo Mowlam amongst others.
fullAddress: Donegal County Museum, High Road, Letterkenny, County Donegal, Ireland

title: The Pintman 8:00 – 8:30
description:
“With a freshly poured pint of stout in front of him and the match not far from kick-off The Pintman couldn’t be more in his element. And with an audience willing to listen to his stories he will make the bar his stage.”

Pintman is the odyssey of man and his pub. And those things that bind them: the pint of plain and a stranger's ear.

This piece is written by Mark Aylward and will be performed by Martin Brennan for Culture Night Dublin 2024, when there will be 30-minute performances at 18:00 and 20:00 in the upstairs venue of Slattery's Pub in Dublin 4.

Email us info@slatterysd4.ie or just ask at the bar about reserving your seat.

locations.title: Dublin City - Trinity And The Docklands

fullAddress: Slattery's Pub D4, Grand Canal Street Upper, Beggar's Bush, Dublin, Ireland

title: The Pintman 18:00-18:30
description:
“With a freshly poured pint of stout in front of him and the match not far from kick-off The Pintman couldn’t be more in his element. And with an audience willing to listen to his stories he will make the bar his stage.”

Pintman is the odyssey of man and his pub. And those things that bind them: the pint of plain and a stranger's ear.

This piece is written by Mark Aylward and will be performed by Martin Brennan for Culture Night Dublin 2024, when there will be 30-minute performances at 18:00 and 20:00 in the upstairs venue of Slattery's Pub in Dublin 4.

title: The Quiet Man to An Cailín Ciúin , A Nostalgic Night at the Movies
description:
After a summer sailing and a starring role during the

Galway International Arts Festival Bádóirí an Chladaigh return to the

Claddagh Basin again as hosts for Culture Night 2024

Short excerpts and music from some of Irelands best loved films will be

projected onto the white sails of The Manuela. These sails were templated and hand cut in the Shantalla Community Centre and then crafted and sewn in Mervue by Cailean and Danny Bailey,

following a long tradition of sail making by their father Johnny Bailey from the West – End .

The beloved hookers and gleóiteogs, these floating sculptures that grace our coast and harbours, are a combination of design, craft, art, and seamanship. These boats and those men and women who sail them are an integral part of Galway life and culture. Their story is Galways story.

So join The Naomh Crónan, The Manuela and The Meaircín Joe

at Claddagh Basin for a nostalgic evening of Irish Cinema.

Boats in Full sail from 1900 to 2230

A Night at the Movies visuals and music from @ 2015 to 2200

Event is dedicated to the great work of the Claddagh Watch patrol volunteers
fullAddress: Claddagh Basin, Canal Road Upper, Galway, Ireland

title: The Rambling house
description:
Join us for an evening of poetry, storytelling, music, songs, dance and classical guitar.
Special guests, Norma and Christopher Fry will perform the tango.
Anne Rigney will also exhibit a selection of her mixed media paintings.
fullAddress: Knockcroghery Community Centre, Knockcroghery, County Roscommon, Ireland

genres.title: Visual Arts (Painting, Photography, Sculpture, Digital Art, Print, Etc)

title: The Road Less Travelled
description:
The exhibition explores the lives of 21 skilled artists including well known local makers like Etain Hickey and Les Claque.

These vibrant portraits capture the energy and imagination of featured artists in Anna's signature style.
fullAddress: Clonakilty Library(Leabharlann Chloich na Coillte), Kent Street, Youghals, Clonakilty, County Cork, Ireland

title: The Rossville Group. Celebrating Three Decades at the Heart of the Community
description:
Join us in Eden Place Arts Centre on Culture Night as we celebrate the creativity of The Rossville Group on their 30th year of inclusive community integration from their base at Pilots Row Centre.

The group will showcase their recent works which include Pinhole Photography, through which they explored the rich visual culture distinctive to the location around them.

Exhibition will continue until 4th October. Viewing times; Mon-Fri 10am-7pm.

title: The Secrets and Mysteries of Freemasonry at Doneraile Court
description:
Have you always wondered what exactly the Freemasons did? What it represented? What kind of world Elisabeth St Leger was initiated into as a young girl in Doneraile court in 1713.

Doneraile Court is inextricably linked to being the first place that a lady Freemason was initiated into the order in 1713.
Elisabeth Aldworth (nee St Leger) was only 17 when she inadvertently witnessed a Freemason meeting in Doneraile court in 1713.

She was initiated as a Freemason subsequently as the other consequences were unthinkable for a daughter of the house.
Elisabeth historically became the very first woman to be initiated into the order, and the first Lady Freemason.
Freemasonry is often clouded with mystery and secrecy throughout the ages, we have invited members of the Provincial grand lodge of Munster to enlighten and clarify our perceptions of modern Freemasons.

If you would like to attend, we have 40 free tickets only, in celebration of Culture Night 2024
The event will start at 3pm and tickets are given out on a first come first served basis, starting at 2pm tickets will be given out from Doneraile Court ticket office.
fullAddress: Doneraile Wildlife Park, Demesne, Doneraile, County Cork, Ireland

We will also demonstrate the basic ogham signs for children and show them what Ogham looked like and how Irish people knew how to write many centuries ago.

description:

The story of the Gallowglass warriors is tied to the naming of the town Bealach an Doirín / The Way of the Little Oak Wood.

We are using shadow puppetry to illustrate how the story of the warriors is tied to Ballaghaderreen. The workshop will start with a shadow puppet demonstration and then we invite you to create your own Gallowglass puppets and experiment with retelling the story in your own words.

This event is a chance for families to work together in doing something creative. It is suitable for all ages so can be an intergenerational activity. Children, parents and grandparents can all work together to explore and make their own version of history.

title: The Sounds of Medieval Ireland 1300-1650
description:
To celebrate Culture Night 2024, Maynooth Castle presents a concert of the type of songs which would have once filled the halls of Maynooth Castle from the 14th to the 17th centuries, based on surviving sources from the period. The FitzGerald family were at the height of musical culture in their time. In records from the 1500s, we see an organ-maker and a trumpeter in their rent book, and an Irish harper on retainer among their court. This concert illustrates the multicultural music landscape of medieval and early modern Ireland, and the contentious place of Irish music in constructing national identities in both Ireland and England.

The concert is free admission and will take place at 7pm on the 20th of September, in the castle's keep. Please note there are no toilets on site. Disability access to rear of building.

Programme:
Maiden in the Mor Lay (Anon., English, 14th c.)
Ich Am of Irlaunde (Anon., English, 14th c.)

Larga Manus Brigide (Extract from The Office of St. Brigid) (Anon. Irish, 15th c.)

L’Homme Armé (Anon. French, 15th c.)
Quant le Russinol (Anon. French, 15th c.)

Laoi na Mná Móire (Trad., Irish, Unknown date)

King Orfeo (Child Ballad 19) (Trad., Scots, Unknown date)

Dulcis Amica Dei (Prioris, French, 16th c.)
O Lord in Thee is All My Trust (Tallis, English, 16th c.)
Sciathlúireach Mhuire (Trad., Irish, 16th/17th c.)

Caleno Custure Me,"Cailín ó Chois tSiúre mé" (Trad./Byrd, Irish/English, 16th.c)
Now O Now I Needs Must Part (Dowland, English/Irish(?), 16th c.)

Eleanor, a Rún (Ó Dálaigh, Irish, 17th c.)

title: The Stork and the Stories: Exhibition, Installation and Workshop by Niki Collier

This event will showcase some of Niki’s award-winning installations in an exhibit of photography. As part of the evening’s programme, guests are also invited to get involved in our art workshop.

This event is part of the European Culture Trail – a EUNIC Ireland (European Union National Institutes for Culture) initiative in cooperation with the European Commission Representation in Ireland. Immerse yourself in the diversity of European languages and cultures on the European Culture Trail, where delights from different European countries await you.

For those visiting European Culture Trail events in person, you are invited to download the “European Culture Trail Treasure Hunt” passport here: https://rb.gy/4cbske and collect stamps or signatures at each stop. The passports with the most stamps at the end of the night will be entered into a raffle for the chance to win wonderful prizes.

title: The Universal Language
description:
A Sound Art installation celebrating Fermoy's Cultural Diversity.

This is a collaboration between sound artist Duncan O'Cleirigh and Fermoy International Choir.

While studying an MA in Experimental Sound Practice in UCC, the producer and sound
artist Duncan O’Cleirigh started to explore the idea of extended drone-like sounds.

Further experimenting lead to the idea of a piece made entirely from voices.
Often when people hear music, it is the sound of the voice, the melody, or the instrument
that draws them even if they do not understand the words. Singing is one of the oldest
ways in which we make music.

The idea of using a choir to be the source of the voices came about as a result of a chat
between Duncan O’Cleirigh and Fermoy International Choir musical director Lisa Dunphy.
The choirs inclusive, positive ethos really fitted with the idea of a universally understood,
voice based sound art installation. This project celebrates our common humanity.
It also celebrates community. Diverse, bustling and bubbling with life.

We all have similar cares and joys in life. We are all one.
This piece has no words. It changes and shifts. Does it have a beginning or end? You are
invited to sit in the physical spaceman let the sounds wash past you.

It provides a sonic space to reflect on our shared human.
Take a little time.
Pause, listen and think.

The material showcased is published in the Write-on Anthology 2025, which will be formally launched on Culture Night. The President Michael D. Higgins has traditionally launched our annual Anthology and we are awaiting confirmation that he will do the same this year.

title: Theatre On-Demand: ‘The Making of Mollie’
description:
Filmed this year following a successful run of in-person shows at The Ark, ‘The Making Of Mollie’ by Anna Carey is available to stream on-demand into your classroom, home, community centre, and more this Culture Night - no matter where you live, as part of our Live From The Ark programme.

In 1912 Dublin, 14-year-old Mollie Carberry’s life is pretty boring. That is, until she discovers that her older sister Phyllis is a secret suffragette! Mollie starts to realise just how unfair the world can be - and she wants to do something about it. When Mollie and her friend Nora get involved in the movement, they must face an important question: just how far should a girl go for her beliefs?

This charming and witty new play invites you to step into a very different time and join Mollie as she begins her journey to find her place in the world.

For children ages 8+.

Please note there is a Jotform link live to sign-up now on this page, but the links to stream will not be sent until 10am on September 20th. So we welcome early sign-ups now, but we will make sure the link and information for streaming is at the top of everyone’s inbox on the 20th September. The Jotform for sign-ups is linked within the booking page below.

title: Theatre Royal, Remembered with the Compton Organ
description:
A unique chance to hear the lovingly restored Savoy Compton Organ, and the story of Dublin’s legendary Theatre Royal.

Come and join Compton Organist extraordinaire Rónán Murray, along with Conor Doyle as Narrator, and singers Gerry Noonan (baritone) and Kathleen Noonan (soprano), as they bring back to life the greatest international stars the world had to offer. Legends appearing on the theatre's stage included Judy Garland, Jimmy Durante, Nat King Cole, Bill Haley and his Comets, Sean Connery, Walt Disney, Liberace and many more.

Then of course there were the Irish performers: Jimmy O'Dea, Noel Purcell, Maureen Potter, Peggy Dell, Jack Cruise, Patricia Cahill and Josef Locke. This special performance will look at these Irish stars and the connections they also had to Limerick's beloved Savoy Theatre.

Included also is rarely seen original film footage of the last night of the Royal. as well as photographs, autographs and the stories of one of Europe’s greatest variety theatres.

This highly acclaimed Theatre Royal Show has already sold out over thirty times in the National Concert Hall, Dublin’s Tivoli Theatre, Dublin’s City Hall and Mansion House.

Musical Director: Pauline Cooper.

title: They Also Serve by Martina Murphy
description: ‘They Also Serve…’ is an original play by best-selling author, Martina Murphy. Directed by Claire Joyce, for Down at Heel Productions, it is a madcap, emotional, theatrical voyage through the early and late years of John Devoy’s life and asks the question – is liberty worth the sacrifice? Dubbed by the London Times as ‘The most dangerous enemy this country (UK) has produced since Wolfe Tone’, Kildare man, John Devoy wanted to lay down his life for Ireland. But his plans were thwarted when in 1871, he was banished to America as a traitor. Fifty-three years later, he arrived back to a hero’s welcome. He was, in Pearse’s words, ‘the greatest of all the fenians’. Come join us Down at Heel Productions on Culture Night for an extraordinary play about an extraordinary man – a man who lost all he loved and won it back again.

title: Timelines, Growth and Catastrophe | Exhibition Launch
description:
Curated by Frances Crowe.
Artists Muriel Beckett, Tish Canniffe, Frances Crowe, Pascale De Coninck, Lorna Donlon, Terry Dunne, Catherine Ryan, Heather Underwood.
Timelines Tapestry Group Project
The exhibition Timelines: Growth and Catastrophe, opening on Culture Night, 20th September and running through October 2024 in Roscommon Arts Centre, is the third large scale collaborative venture undertaken by eight tapestry weavers working across the country of Ireland. Many of the artists involved have woven professionally for decades and their work has been widely exhibited. For others, tapestry weaving is part of their creative practice. Each continue to work on their own work in studios whilst also collaborating on Timelines since 2012.
Supported by Creative Ireland funding for this project through Roscommon, Laois, Wexford, Cork City and Cork County Local Authority Arts Offices, eight weavers; Muriel Beckett; Tish Canniffe; Frances Crowe; Pascale De Coninck; Lorna Donlon; Terry Dunne; Catherine Ryan and Heather Underwood collaborated at all stages from initial concept / idea right through development of a design / cartoon as well as the physical weaving of the large 1 X 10 metre handwoven tapestry Timelines: Growth and Catastrophe the title piece of this exhibition.
The title Timelines: Growth and Catastrophe borrows a term used in biology to describe a dynamic process in which proteins called microtubules constantly extend and shrink in a cell. For us, Growth and Catastrophe.
fullAddress: Roscommon, Ireland
